Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do


You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).


About You


You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English


Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.




Who We Are

At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.

By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.

Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.

If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing scale-ups in Europe and working on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.




Your Challenge

As a member of our data science team, you will take on the task of developing bidding optimizations through NLP applications, such as large language models, scalable embeddings, and network analysis solutions.
You will be responsible for building and improving bidding functionalities which will have a direct impact on our client’s advertising KPIs.
You will explore the applicability of LLMs for production, crafting solutions that can handle real-world, large-scale challenges, particularly in areas like contextualization, personalization, and relevance optimization.
You will work on end-to-end projects, taking solutions from concept to production, and focusing on creating scalable, efficient, and impactful solutions.
Collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams, your work will be aligned with business goals and drive the practical application of your solutions.




Our core values

Outcome over output

Our core tech values reflect our commitment to delivering exceptional results, fostering a culture of continuous learning, and always putting the customer's needs first. We believe that success comes from focusing on the outcomes rather than just the output. Our tech team aims to solve problems that make a meaningful difference, and we measure our success by the impact we have on the customer.

Failure is allowed, learning is a must

We also recognize that failure is an inevitable part of the innovation process. Our team understands that setbacks are opportunities to learn and grow. We believe in testing early and often, and we continuously iterate and improve until we arrive at the best solution.

We are all scouts

Another core value we hold is that we are all scouts. We believe in leaving things better than we found them. This means we take ownership of our work and strive to improve the systems and processes we touch. We encourage our team members to be proactive in identifying areas for improvement, and we value those who take the initiative to implement positive changes. Our goal is to leave a lasting, positive impact on our projects and our team.

We are data-driven

Lastly, our team is data-driven. We believe that making informed decisions based on data is crucial to our success. Our team uses data to guide our decision-making process and to identify opportunities for improvement. We are committed to using data to continuously monitor and optimize our models and processes to ensure that we are delivering the best possible outcome for our customers.




Tech Stack

We have to support 120k requests per second running with ML models in production answering within 10 milliseconds! We have this running in production with Python and GoLang microservices using datalakes, GCS, Redis, Kinesis or Kafka. All this is constantly deployed in GCP using Kubernetes and other kinds of production stacks. The current stack outputs 20 TB of daily data having them ready to use for analytics and more with easy and low latency access.

In the rest of the company, we also develop in Typescript for Nodejs and Scala making use of technologies like Kafka, Druid and MongoDB all over the Google Cloud Platform.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

You bring 3-5 years of experience in data science and machine learning, with relevant experience in developing ML/NLP applications at scale to address real-world business challenges.
You possess strong software engineering skills and a track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments, with proficiency in Python and experience in libraries relevant to NLP and embedding frameworks.
You have a strong academic background in fields such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar, with a focus on quantitative analysis and problem-solving.
You have hands-on experience with end-to-end project workflows, from data exploration to deployment, proven ability to scale embeddings for high-volume data environments, and are skilled at managing both the technical and business aspects of data projects.
You are proactive, entrepreneurial, and adaptable, with a commitment to leveraging data and machine learning to drive impactful, measurable business outcomes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.




Why Join Seedtag?

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks

Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
Macbook Pro M3




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!




At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to a 100% remote (Please note that while we operate as a 100% remote company, we can only extend contracts within Europe in countries where we have established legal entities: Spain, Italy, the UK, Belgium, the Netherlands, France, and Germany) or hybrid work setup, depending on what works best.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks

  • Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.
  • Build your home office with a gross budget of up to 1K€ (external screen, chair, table...)
  • Paid travels to our HQ in Madrid to work p2p with your squad members
  • Macbook Pro M3


Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together!


At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data/Pre-Training)
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (LLM Data/Pre-Training)

Europe (remote)

€200-300k base salary + equity




About Us

We’re a fast-growing, well-funded startup currently training a foundational LLM. Our mission is to build cutting-edge Large Language Models (LLMs) that empower businesses and developers to solve real-world problems. We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who is excited about designing robust data pipelines, scaling transformer-based models, and leveraging synthetic data techniques to push the boundaries of what’s possible in NLP.




What You’ll Do

Design & Build Data Pipelines: Own the end-to-end process of gathering, cleaning, and curating massive text datasets—including real-world and synthetic data—to fuel LLM pre-training.
Train Large-Scale Models: Implement and optimize large language model training on GPU/TPU clusters.
Leverage Synthetic Data Generation: Explore and develop methods for data augmentation or synthetic text generation to address low-resource domains, bias mitigation, and overall dataset enrichment.
Optimize Performance: Develop strategies for efficient distributed training, memory optimization, and large-scale deployment.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with research scientists, data engineers, and software engineers to deploy, evaluate, and iterate on LLMs.
Experiment & Innovate: Stay at the cutting edge of NLP by testing new architectures, fine-tuning techniques, and data augmentation strategies.




Who You Are

Technical Expert: You have experience with transformer-based models and have built or contributed to large-scale NLP systems.
Data Savvy: Proficient in data wrangling at scale, including experience with Spark, Ray, or similar distributed frameworks.
Synthetic Data Enthusiast: You’ve experimented with synthetic or augmented data to improve model performance and address data scarcity or bias.
ML Tooling Pro: Skilled in PyTorch and/or TensorFlow, with exposure to libraries like Hugging Face Transformers or Megatron-LM.
Performance Oriented: Able to optimize training pipelines for performance, leveraging GPU/TPU-based clusters.
Problem Solver: You thrive in a dynamic startup environment where creativity, autonomy, and rapid iteration are essential.
Team Player: Strong communication and collaboration skills. You enjoy sharing ideas, mentoring, and driving results together.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer | Relocation to Abu Dhabi | Highly Competitive Salary




Are you ready to push the boundaries of AI and work on cutting-edge machine learning models? We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join an elite team driving innovation in AI. This role is for those who thrive on solving complex challenges, leveraging LLMs, RAG, and Generative AI, and want to make a real impact.




Why Join Us?

✅Work on industry-defining AI solutions with a world-class team.

✅Apply cutting-edge technologies like LLMs, fine-tuning, and generative AI to real-world challenges.

✅A highly competitive, tax-free salary with exceptional benefits.

✅Full relocation to Abu Dhabi, including visa sponsorship for you and your family, educational allowance for children, private healthcare, and an extra flight home every year.

✅One-month extra salary in your first month to help you settle in.




What You’ll Do

✅ Develop and deploy ML models that power next-gen AI solutions.

✅ Work with LLMs, RAG, LangChain, Weaviate, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, and other cutting-edge ML tools.

✅ Solve real-world challenges across multiple industries using AI.

✅ Collaborate with top AI minds in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment.




What We’re Looking For

✅ 5+ years of experience in Machine Learning, AI, or Data Science.

✅ Strong hands-on experience with LLMs, deep learning, and generative AI.

✅ Master’s or Ph.D. in AI, Data Science, Computer Science, or related fields.

✅ Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.

✅ Experience competing in Kaggle, ACM/ICPC, IOI/NOI, or other coding challenges is a plus!




If this sounds interesting, apply now and let’s build the future of AI together!

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Our client empowers salespeople to enhance their pipeline coverage by promoting diligent prospecting practices.




JOB DESCRIPTION




MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Proficient in English, both spoken and written
4 years of proven experience as a developer
Expertise in TypeScript
Experience with AWS and API development
Ability to work remotely




WHO YOU ARE The ideal candidate is an intermediate to senior-level backend engineer with the following skills:




Deep understanding of TypeScript/JavaScript and Node.js
Experience with REST APIs and system integration
Proficient in NoSQL databases (DynamoDB) and RDBMS/SQL queries
Knowledgeable in event-driven/asynchronous programming
Familiar with Git and AWS
Fluent in microservices environments, principles, and patterns
Proficient in written and spoken English
Experienced in CI/CD integration within a pipeline
Capable of designing and maintaining public REST APIs
Skilled in optimization tasks to deliver low latency results




ADDITIONAL VALUABLE EXPERIENCE/SKILLS

Knowledge of Python
Experience deploying and working with ML models/LLMs
Familiarity with the Salesforce ecosystem and Apex language
Involvement in data enrichment/scraping projects
Understanding of Generative AI




WHAT YOU'LL DO

Collaborate with a talented cross-functional engineering team
Write and test interactive, clean, secure, and efficient solutions
Manage the development lifecycle of your projects
Stay updated with backend and web technologies, software architecture principles, and design patterns
Continuously improve codebase, systems, and processes
Engage in constructive peer review and welcome feedback




LOCATION

100% remote




EMPLOYMENT TYPE

Full-time
B2B contract (assistance with taxes available)




WHO WE ARE Our client has developed an advanced Native Salesforce App designed to help salespeople rapidly build pipeline coverage. Leveraging machine learning, this platform serves as the ultimate sales engagement tool for Salesforce. The team is diverse and values contributions from all members, regardless of seniority. They work using agile methodologies, including daily standups, retrospectives, and sprint planning sessions.




If you are a proactive and autonomous Back End Developer with strong capabilities and a passion for driving progression, we would love to hear from you!

Apply Now: Please send your CV and cover letter to my profile or the details attached, to be considered for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!




As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.




What do you get in return?




We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.




As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:




Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy models in production environments, monitor their performance, and optimize for efficiency. Translate business problems into robust data-driven solutions while maintaining best practices in version control, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and convert them into actionable data science projects, ensuring that the solutions align with business objectives.
Data Management and Analysis: Acquire, clean, and integrate data from various sources to address business issues. Use advanced data analytics techniques to manipulate and interpret complex datasets, providing clear insights and answers to critical business questions.
Knowledge and Trend Analysis: Stay informed about the latest industry trends to maintain a competitive edge and apply this knowledge to drive strategic decisions and methodologies within the company.




Let’s do the match?




You have a Bachelors/Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Physics, Actuarial, Statistics, or Mathematics? Check! Knowledge of machine learning principles and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including linear models and tree-based methods for regression and classification? Check! Ability to easily interpret common performance metrics? Check! Advanced skills in Python or R, proficiency in SQL and good knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure)? Double check!




Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow




Allianz is an equal opportunity employer and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior Developer (Python)
Description:
Squareflow is a growing company founded in 2020 by entrepreneurs (just like you). We embrace technology to create business value with Odoo as an enabler. We believe that any business can be digital first.




To strengthen our team, we are looking for junior developer. As a developer, you'll be in regular contact with clients and our teams in order to deliver solutions based on understanding of their specific needs in terms of business business/IT alignment.




Function:




As a junior developer, your specific tasks and responsibilities may include:




Develop solutions for our clients from many different industries, sectors and company size
Support and maintain those specific solutions
Implement the client's needs in the Odoo solution before configuring it
Create training material and documentation for Odoo users
Deliver informative, well-organized demos to business teams
Accompany and train end-users to the new tool (train the trainer approach) on Odoo and related applications
Develop and maintain processes to continuously monitor data quality
Coordinate test execution to ensure that all technical customizations and configurations follow industry and delivery best practices
Contribute to the daily development of Squareflow




Your profile :




Bachelor or Master degree (preferably in business, engineering or computer science)
Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
Structural thinking
Ability to learn and evolve quickly
Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.




We offer:

A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
The possibility to follow regular trainings
The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions




Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

  • Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
  • Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
  • Structural thinking
  • Ability to learn and evolve quickly
  • Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
  • Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
  • Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?


More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.


We offer:

  • A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
  • Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
  • The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
  • The possibility to follow regular trainings
  • The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions


Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.
Show more

Title: Python developer - banking sector
Description:
Location: Brussels, Belgium (with 3 days remote work)

Company: A Leading Bank

About the Role: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Python Developer for our client, a prestigious bank based in the center of Brussels. The ideal candidate will be an expert in Python development, with a strong background in designing, developing, and maintaining complex applications.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code.
Develop and enhance applications that meet the evolving needs of the business.
Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
Maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Senior Python Developer (minimum 5 years)
Expertise in Python development and its frameworks such as Flask, Django, etc.
Strong understanding of object-oriented programming.
Experience with cloud technologies, particularly AWS.
Familiarity with front-end technologies (like JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proficiency in English; knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.

Interested ? Do you want more information ? Don't hesitate to reach me out with your updated CV.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We’re seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you’ll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Greenomy is expanding, join a fast-growing company at the sweet spot between technology and sustainable finance!

At Greenomy, our mission is to accelerate the global transition to a sustainable economy. Our advanced SaaS regulatory reporting platform empowers companies to generate the data needed to comply swiftly and efficiently with the new tide of sustainability regulations at European and global levels. Our technology therefore facilitates the redirection of funds towards sustainable activities, speeding up the transition to a low carbon economy in line with the EU Green Deal.

In order to advance our product development, we are looking for a highly motivated medior or early career AI Engineer to join our team.

How You Will Make An Impact

As an AI Engineer you will be a critical part of our product development efforts. You are a pragmatic, hands-on problem solver who can turn AI and NLP research into real-world solutions to be integrated into our ESG reporting solutions. This role is all about building, deploying, and optimizing AI systems that deliver real impact. For this position we regret that we are unable to offer visa sponsorship but we are open to remote candidates who are based within a comparable timezone.

Your Team Will Work On


Build & Optimize AI Pipelines: Design, develop, and fine-tune AI pipelines, agents, and back-end services for data processing, analysis, and information extraction using deep learning frameworks and generative models.
Develop Practical AI Solutions: Move beyond theory to build functional generative AI and NLP systems that generate meaningful, contextually relevant text.
Data-Driven Implementation: Work with data engineers to preprocess and curate datasets for training, testing, and fine-tuning AI models, ensuring high-quality and reliable data.
Measure & Improve: Establish evaluation frameworks to assess AI pipeline performance and iterate efficiently based on results and user feedback.
Integrate AI into Products: Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and domain experts to bring AI capabilities into production, ensuring they provide real business value.


What We Are Looking For


Entrepreneurial Mindset: Above all, we value a proactive, hands-on approach with a strong sense of ownership and problem-solving.
Education & Experience: Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field with a focus on NLP and AI—or equivalent practical experience.
Programming Expertise: Strong Python skills with deep knowledge of best practices, clean coding, and efficient implementations.
Practical AI Development: Proven ability to design and implement high-performance AI pipelines for data processing, analysis, and information extraction.
NLP Experience: 2+ years working with NLP techniques, solid understanding of NLP concepts, including tokenization, embeddings, semantic search and language modeling.
Generative AI Expertise: Hands-on experience with generative models and libraries like LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI APIs is highly desirable.
Data Handling & Model Training: Experience with large-scale dataset preprocessing, training, fine-tuning, and evaluation of AI models.
Problem-Solving & Innovation: Strong analytical thinking with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex challenges.
Communication Skills: Ability to effectively convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


It’s an advantage if you have any of the following:


Startup or Fast-Paced Tech Experience: Prior experience in a startup or dynamic tech environment where adaptability and problem-solving are key.
AI Product Development: Hands-on experience bringing AI-driven products to life, from concept to deployment.
Deep Learning Frameworks: Proficiency in PyTorch for building, training, and evaluating generative models (e.g., GPT, Transformers) is a strong plus.
Cloud & Infrastructure: Practical experience leveraging Azure services for machine learning, particularly Azure AI Foundry.
Kubernetes Knowledge: Familiarity with container orchestration and deployment in production environments.


What You Can Expect From Us


Compensation package tailored to your skills and experience.
A flexible and remote-friendly work environment.
Opportunity to build your core skills internally and via external trainings.
Regular team-building events.
A fast-growing company with a sense of purpose operating in a highly innovative space.
An entrepreneurial, international, and dynamic work environment.
A complementary team with a balanced skill and seniority mix that will support you and help you perform.
A strong recognition for your individual and collective contributions.
A highly caring team that embraces diversity


More About Greenomy And Our Values

Greenomy is a Brussels-based company founded in late 2020. Our partially remote team comprises passionate, diverse and complementary individuals from over 15 countries. We are fortunate to count on the trust and support of outstanding clients and strategic partners across Europe and beyond. We also have the backing of Euroclear, our first client who became our investor in February 2022. Our commitment to bringing innovative sustainability solutions to the market has been recognized on several occasions. Recent awards include “Best Sustainability Solution'' at the 2022 SIBOS in Amsterdam and first place at the 2021 G20 Techsprint for Sustainable Finance solutions in Milan.

We believe our ambition can only become a reality with a strong team spirit, drive for purpose, and eagerness to learn. We feel a responsibility to create a safe space for everyone. We bring diversity and inclusion are at the top of our agenda. Last but not least, as a sustainability company, we need to walk the talk!

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability).
Show more

Title: Test Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only

WHAT CREAM IS ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport sectors.

CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)

WHAT IS A TEST ENGINEER AT CREAM ?

As a Test Engineer, you will work in close collaboration with analysts and developers in order to run projects related to:

Front end and back end applications
Mobile and tablet applications for the end users
Websites and e-commerce solutions
Deployment of automated systems




YOUR TASKS :

Validation and probation of the functional and technical specifications
Design test plan: procedures, scenarios, components
Organize and execute tests
Follow-up internal development phases in collaboration with the project manager
Test evaluation through the anomalies follow-up and test cover
Provide support during the validation phase before deployment: users acceptance testing and functional testing




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a University Degree in the Information Technologies field (Civil Engineer, Master in Computer Sciences, or related fields)
At least 2 years of experience in software testing
You have a proven experience in structured testing as a System Tester for IT projects
Very good knowledge of testing tools and methodologies among others:
Experience with HP QC, HP ALM or QTP
Knowledge of UML modelling and Use Cases writing
You have the ability to communicate easily on technical subjects with developers
You are fluent in French and English, a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

Bonus

A training or a certification in ISTQB would be a real asset
Knowledge in TFS and XMLA training or a certification in ISTQB would be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE : CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




🤖 What you’ll be doing

• Identify, analyze, and translate business challenges into AI-driven solutions

• Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and data-driven insights

• Work with stakeholders to define AI use cases and align them with business objectives

• Collect, clean, and preprocess data for analysis and modeling

• Evaluate and optimize AI models for performance, scalability, and business impact

• Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences

• Ensure ethical AI practices, data governance, and compliance with industry standards

• Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, data science, and machine learning

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and business analysts




🧠 Skills & qualifications

• 2 to 4 years of experience in AI, data science, or analytics

• Strong knowledge of machine learning, data analysis, and statistical modeling

• Hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)

• Ability to bridge the gap between technical and business needs

• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib)

• Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work autonomously

• Flexibility to adapt to new challenges and environments

• Fluent in FR or NL + strong command of English

• A team-player attitude and a good sense of humor 😊




💡 What Movify offers

• Structured training in AI, data science, and emerging technologies

• An agile and fast-paced environment

• A culture of empowerment, openness, and autonomy

• Room for personal and professional development

• A competitive package

• A passionate and supportive team

Show more
HTML:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?


🤖 What you’ll be doing

• Identify, analyze, and translate business challenges into AI-driven solutions

• Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and data-driven insights

• Work with stakeholders to define AI use cases and align them with business objectives

• Collect, clean, and preprocess data for analysis and modeling

• Evaluate and optimize AI models for performance, scalability, and business impact

• Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences

• Ensure ethical AI practices, data governance, and compliance with industry standards

• Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, data science, and machine learning

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and business analysts


🧠 Skills & qualifications

• 2 to 4 years of experience in AI, data science, or analytics

• Strong knowledge of machine learning, data analysis, and statistical modeling

• Hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)

• Ability to bridge the gap between technical and business needs

• Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib)

• Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work autonomously

• Flexibility to adapt to new challenges and environments

• Fluent in FR or NL + strong command of English

• A team-player attitude and a good sense of humor 😊


💡 What Movify offers

• Structured training in AI, data science, and emerging technologies

• An agile and fast-paced environment

• A culture of empowerment, openness, and autonomy

• Room for personal and professional development

• A competitive package

• A passionate and supportive team

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
HTML:
• At least 8 years of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Large Language Model prompt engineering.;
  • At least 7 years of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality, and advanced data retrieval tools;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer - Remote - Up to $50K




I’m partnered with an innovative startup that’s building AI-driven solutions for the Financial Services sector, currently focused on delivering a groundbreaking product set to launch later this year. They’re building cutting-edge tools to solve complex problems in the world of qualitative equity research, and they need an AI Engineer to help make it happen.




We’re looking for someone with:




1-2 years of experience in AI/ML development.
Expertise in text extraction from PDFs, including OCR and natural language processing techniques.
Experience fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) for specialised use cases.
Proficiency in Python, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Knowledge of NLP libraries such as spaCy, Hugging Face, or similar tools.




This is a unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup and make a real impact on the development of transformative products. You’ll work closely with a talented team, using cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world challenges in the financial industry.




If you’re passionate about AI and excited to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now.

Title: AI Expert ( NLP, ML)
Description:
Hello,

We are called People More because we treat our employees with respect, but also because the projects we work on are for people and should be easy and pleasant to use. We are technological, but we look at the bigger picture :)

People More has been in existence for over three years and is an offshoot of one of the country's oldest interactive agencies - Insignia. The company is made up of people with a huge client base in the country and abroad, for whom we build projects from scratch (UX, UI, frontend, backend, mobile) or in part. We work directly for our clients and also support our partners in their own solutions. This ensures a wide range of projects and the ability to change! We work with clients all over the world.

For the project that we are working on with our foreign partner, we are looking for AI Expert (NLP / ML)

Your Duties Will Include


Developing and optimizing AI/ML and NLP models using advanced algorithms.
Deploying AI solutions in the cloud and utilizing containerization and version control.
Analyzing, modeling, and processing data, including exploration and segmentation.
Tracking new AI technologies and supporting their integration with IT systems.


Requirements That Must Be Met


At least 5 years of professional experience in AI development, including machine learning and NLP.
Proven expertise in Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Strong command of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, and AI frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage.
Ability to adapt to evolving AI technologies and methodologies.
Hands-on experience in data preparation and cleaning for AI and machine learning models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker) for AI/ML application deployment.
Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is a plus.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (GitHub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g., Data Services, Talend, etc.).
Strong technical proficiency in database design, data modeling, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Relocation to Belgium required
Very good English and Polish


What We Offer


We are open and honest and we solve problems instead of generating them.
Maybe it’s obvious, but we really respect our employees and associates. We used to be software developers, too, and we appreciate that job!
A small team
An international working environment and international projects
Private medical care
Sports card
Training courses
Hybrid work in Belgium


If you are not sure if you meet the requirements, apply—we’ll talk and give you an honest answer.

Why it’s a good idea to work with People More?


If you are not satisfied with your work or your tasks, we’ll find a way out together!
If you get bored, we will offer you a new product and new, fascinating tasks
We will work on your brand together: you will get an opportunity to attend conferences, including as a speaker, and we will help you publish in recognized magazines and online
We will facilitate your access to challenges that are usually difficult to get
At any time, you can talk directly to the board of People More—we talk your language because the company’s founders are software developers and designers!


What does the recruitment process look like?


A friendly remote initial interview
A remote technical talk
The decision to work together!


Salary

230 - 300 zł/h

contract

B2B

Location

Belgium / Brussels
Show more

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
VeroTech is looking for an AI Research Engineer, with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM)!




Are you interested in working with the most advanced and cutting-edge digital transformation industry? We’re VeroTech, a Belgian engineering consultancy company specialized in R&D projects, currently looking for talented engineers.




Your mission

As an AI Research Engineer, you will leverage your knowledge in language-based AI to design and implement new system architectures, processes, and proof-of-concepts for accurate chatbots. Your responsibilities will include:

Developing and testing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for various data sources.
Designing agentic, knowledge-supported LLM architectures tailored to different stakeholders.
Exploring and applying prompt engineering techniques.
Leading and collaborating with the research team.
Training and mentoring team members to share knowledge and skills.




Your profile

Master's or PhD in Artificial Intelligence (AI).
Minimum 3 years of experience in language-based AI with recent research on LLMs for production industries.
A research-oriented mindset with a focus on technological innovation and achieving results for top industries.
Proficiency in Dutch and English, both written and spoken.
Experience in mentoring and working collaboratively with junior colleagues.




Why join VeroTech?

A motivating salary package, with the possibility of working from home and a company car
Improve your skillset within challenging mid to long-term R&D projects in a variety of high tech industries
Join an inspiring community of engineers with a range in expertise and experience levels
Work in a people-oriented company in an informal working environment
Support in your professional career from a business team providing technical and business related trainings

Show more

Title: Software Engineer (AI / ML)
Description:
Hey! Thanks for taking the time to read through one of our open roles. We’re looking for an exceptional Software Engineer (AI/ML) to join our Research & Development team and we hope this could be a match made in heaven.




Who is Peppy?

Our mission is to fix healthcare & wellbeing. We do this by supporting the employees of our global clients, including JP Morgan, Disney, Meta, Nvidia, Microsoft, Sony, Clifford Chance, Wells Fargo, Bloomberg, and over 200 others.




Having already revolutionised the employee benefits sector with our innovative clinical products – such as the world’s first menopause benefit – we are now building the world’s most advanced benefits management platform. Think of us as a “Deel for Benefits” – a rocket-ship opportunity with a mission that truly matters. The global benefits sector encompasses employer-funded pensions, critical illness insurance, private healthcare insurance, and many other categories. This is a trillion-dollar TAM with weak, incumbent competition and almost no AI-first startups stepping up to the challenge.




We are a Series B company with $56m in funding to date, operationally cashflow positive, and with secure access to additional capital for accelerated growth. Join us for the ride of your life.




What will a day in the life of our Software Engineer (AI/ML) look like?

Build AI-first features end-to-end: You’ll contribute to the design, deployment, and iteration of our next-generation benefits platform features that leverage personalization, experimentation, and AI/ML methods (e.g. agents/LLMs, recommender systems, reinforcement learning) to enhance user experience in a meaningful business domain.
Stay versatile across the stack: You’ll work in React (JavaScript/TypeScript) on the frontend and Python on the backend, shipping production-ready code and user-facing features in addition to innovative ML work.
Engage in data pipelines & ML workflows: From data ingestion and feature engineering to model deployment and monitoring, you’ll help shape how we deliver advanced personalization and recommendations to our users.
Keep code clean and well-tested: Maintain clean, efficient, and tested code with clear documentation for both peers and future reference.
Participate in agile, cross-functional teams: Collaborate closely with design, product, and beyond to deliver impactful user and business outcomes, bringing a user-focused perspective to the development process.
Review, refine, and grow: Actively participate in peer reviews, CI/CD processes, and a growth-minded engineering culture, where you continuously seek to level up your technical skills.
Be a team player: Sometimes you’ll be iterating on ML pipelines; other times you’ll be refining a frontend component or fixing a tricky bug. We need someone who’s excited about the full product journey and moving together as one.
Broaden your impact: Gain a deeper understanding of how engineering efforts support various business functions (clinical ops, service delivery, sales, marketing) and seek opportunities to enhance user satisfaction and operational efficiency.




Our dream Software Engineer (AI/ML) will have:

Academic/Applied ML Background: A solid foundation in machine learning—particularly in recommender systems and personalization—gained through an advanced degree (MSc or higher) or equivalent practical experience.
Industry Experience (3+ years): Prior experience contributing to impactful products in fast-paced or startup environments, with an understanding of both scale and quality from larger tech organizations.
Hands-On Full Stack Skills: Proficiency in React/Typescript and Python (RESTful APIs, data pipelines), plus comfort with deploying and maintaining services on modern cloud platforms (GCP preferred, AWS or Azure also fine).
Recommender Systems & Personalization Know-How: Familiarity with data engineering, collaborative filtering, content-based filtering, or other ML-driven personalization strategies—and eagerness to deepen this knowledge.
Team-Oriented Mindset: Strong communication skills for explaining complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences, and a passion for collaborating within cross-functional teams.
A Desire to Ship: Motivation to see your projects—ML or otherwise—get shipped to production and tested with real users, and to continually improve them based on feedback.
Strong Coding Practices & Curiosity: A commitment to writing efficient, scalable, and maintainable code, along with a willingness to learn new technologies, investigate emerging trends, and build quick prototypes.




You may not check all of these boxes, and that’s totally fine! We strongly encourage excited candidates of all backgrounds to apply.




Still looking for more intel? Here’s some other really cool things about Peppy which might be helpful:

We raised a $45mil Series B fundraise January 2023, led by Albion VC
We’re one of Europe’s fastest growing HealthTech scale-ups
We are remote-first, headquartered in the UK with 100+ employees across the UK, USA and Europe
We're proudly B-corp certified and mission-led
We are rated one of the Top Startups to work for by LinkedIn, Sifted, Tempo and Flexa




Much like us, we know you’re into perks and benefits, so here’s a list of ours:

Access to Peppy: You can receive free unlimited access to the Peppy app to use our Menopause, Fertility, Baby, Women’s Health or Men’s Health services
Health & Wellbeing: You will receive Private Medical Insurance through Vitality, including VitalityGP, optical, dental and hearing coverage
Financial Wellness: You have access to your own confidential financial wellbeing coach and resources, through Bippit
Parental Leave: We have a generous Enhanced Family Leave policy, whether you or your partner are giving birth, going through surrogacy or adoption
Pension: We offer an up to 5% employer pension contribution scheme through Cushon
Holidays: Peppy employees in the UK get 25 days holiday per year, plus bank holidays
Remote-First: We're a remote-first business, rather than remote-only. This person can be based remotely from anywhere in Europe
Socials: We encourage our employees to join our in-person team events and socials to build stronger connections within your team. If you live outside London, your travel expenses for these events are on us too!
Tech: New joiners receive a company MacBook delivered in time for your first day




Package on offer for our Software Engineer (AI/ML):

Salary of £90,000 to £110,000/annum dependent on your experience
Stock options grant to enable you to share in our future collective success




Equality & Diversity:

Peppy's mission is to help people in life's most challenging journeys. We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to equality and diversity amongst both our employees and prospective applicants. We ensure that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process.

Title: Data Scientist _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:


Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.


Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:


Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !
