HTML:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:

  • Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
  • Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
  • Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
  • Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
  • Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.

Un job fait pour vous ?

  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:

  • Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
  • Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
  • En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
  • Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
  • Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
  • Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
  • Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :

  • Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
  • Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
  • Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
  • Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
  • Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
  • Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.




Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.




Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR …)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AWS).
Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring tools.
Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KPIs.
Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaboration.
Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholders.
Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applications.
Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitudes

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking.
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges.
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focused.
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks.

Education an Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.

2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many others
Continued education and access to trainings
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment




Show more

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Integration and maintenance of software applications or services in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in different technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), Information Extraction, Knowledge Graphs (KG) or Graph Data Science (GDS);
  • Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
  • Prompt engineering on Large Language Models and validation of results with the business/policy officers;
  • Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
  • Ιnteracting with policy officers, data stewards and other stakeholders to understand business and data needs, turn them into use cases, prototypes or statements of work and eventually support the solution acceptance process;
  • Defining data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality, integrity and Performance;
  • Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
  • Designing the IT architecture and hosting solutions and coordinate its implementation considering cloud technologies, containers, DevOps, master- and metadata management concepts and security;
  • Contributing to the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and deriving the IT requirements.


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Perl, Python, Matlab, R and their NLP/ML libraries (SpaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, pandas);
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • At least 8 years of specific expertise in Large Language Model prompt engineering.;
  • At least 7 years of specific expertise in query languages, such as SQL, Hive, Pig, etc and with information extraction;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data management and analytics, including data quality, and advanced data retrieval tools;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in AWS, Azure or other cloud platforms;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in machine learning systems lifecycle;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise software development methodologies such as Agile or RUP;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, Neo4j, etc;
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in data analytics over big datasets, non-structured databases as well as data lakes, including data visualisation tools (e.g. D3.js, knowledge graphs, etc.);
  • At least 5 years of specific expertise in applied statistics, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc;
  • A certification in AWS Certified Machine Learning, Microsoft Azure AI Engineer Associate, SAS Certified Professional AI or Machine Learning Certification will be considered a valuable asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language and French language will be considered an asset.


Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18196/02/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.


EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: AI Expert ( NLP, ML)
Description:
Hello,

We are called People More because we treat our employees with respect, but also because the projects we work on are for people and should be easy and pleasant to use. We are technological, but we look at the bigger picture :)

People More has been in existence for over three years and is an offshoot of one of the country's oldest interactive agencies - Insignia. The company is made up of people with a huge client base in the country and abroad, for whom we build projects from scratch (UX, UI, frontend, backend, mobile) or in part. We work directly for our clients and also support our partners in their own solutions. This ensures a wide range of projects and the ability to change! We work with clients all over the world.

For the project that we are working on with our foreign partner, we are looking for AI Expert (NLP / ML)

Your Duties Will Include


Developing and optimizing AI/ML and NLP models using advanced algorithms.
Deploying AI solutions in the cloud and utilizing containerization and version control.
Analyzing, modeling, and processing data, including exploration and segmentation.
Tracking new AI technologies and supporting their integration with IT systems.


Requirements That Must Be Met


At least 5 years of professional experience in AI development, including machine learning and NLP.
Proven expertise in Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Strong command of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, and AI frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage.
Ability to adapt to evolving AI technologies and methodologies.
Hands-on experience in data preparation and cleaning for AI and machine learning models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker) for AI/ML application deployment.
Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is a plus.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (GitHub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g., Data Services, Talend, etc.).
Strong technical proficiency in database design, data modeling, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Relocation to Belgium required
Very good English and Polish


What We Offer


We are open and honest and we solve problems instead of generating them.
Maybe it’s obvious, but we really respect our employees and associates. We used to be software developers, too, and we appreciate that job!
A small team
An international working environment and international projects
Private medical care
Sports card
Training courses
Hybrid work in Belgium


If you are not sure if you meet the requirements, apply—we’ll talk and give you an honest answer.

Why it’s a good idea to work with People More?


If you are not satisfied with your work or your tasks, we’ll find a way out together!
If you get bored, we will offer you a new product and new, fascinating tasks
We will work on your brand together: you will get an opportunity to attend conferences, including as a speaker, and we will help you publish in recognized magazines and online
We will facilitate your access to challenges that are usually difficult to get
At any time, you can talk directly to the board of People More—we talk your language because the company’s founders are software developers and designers!


What does the recruitment process look like?


A friendly remote initial interview
A remote technical talk
The decision to work together!


Salary

230 - 300 zł/h

contract

B2B

Location

Belgium / Brussels
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast Kan Je Rekenen Op


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over De Selectieprocedure

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75
Show more
HTML:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat Betekent

  • Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
  • Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
  • Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
  • Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
  • Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.

Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?

  • Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.

Je Herkent Jezelf In De Volgende Competenties

  • Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
  • Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
  • Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
  • Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
  • Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
  • Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.

Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Title: ServiceNow Developer
Description:
As a ServiceNow Developer, you will be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of ServiceNow solutions. You will work with a team to ensure the integration of ServiceNow with various systems, optimize workflows, and provide support for continuous improvement. This is an exciting opportunity to make an impact in a rapidly evolving IT environment.




Responsibilities:

Develop, customize, and configure ServiceNow modules (ITSM, ITOM, ITBM, etc.) based on business requirements.
Write clear, structured, and reusable code for ServiceNow applications and ensure their scalability.
Collaborate with business analysts and other stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Implement best practices for ServiceNow design and development.
Perform configuration tasks within the ServiceNow platform, including workflows, business rules, and UI policies.
Integrate ServiceNow with other systems using APIs and web services.
Optimize SQL queries and enhance the performance of ServiceNow instances.
Provide support for ServiceNow applications and help resolve issues or incidents in a timely manner.
Participate in code reviews and technical meetings with internal teams to ensure the quality of the solutions.
Create and maintain technical documentation, including system architecture and development guides.




Skills & Qualifications:

Experience: Minimum of 3 years professional experience as a ServiceNow Developer with hands-on experience in ServiceNow configurations and customizations.




Technical Expertise:

Strong knowledge of ServiceNow platform and its modules (e.g., ITSM, ITOM, ITBM, etc.).
Proficiency in scripting languages such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for ServiceNow.
Strong knowledge of SQL/PL-SQL and relational databases (Oracle preferred).
Experience with XML technologies and SOAP/REST web services.
Experience in SQL performance tuning, including analytic functions.
Strong understanding of microservices architecture.
Familiarity with development tools such as TOAD, JIRA, and similar platforms.




Soft Skills:

Excellent communication skills and the ability to present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to create detailed and clear technical documentation.
Collaborative team player with the ability to manage competing priorities and tasks.




Additional Qualifications:

Good knowledge of large organization administrative business processes.
Understanding of Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) and best practices.
Experience with Data Warehouse architecture and optimization.
Strong knowledge of ITIL processes and practices.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work in an innovative and supportive environment.
Access to continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Flexibility and work-life balance options.

Show more

Title: AI/ML/NLP Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI/ML/NLP Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert remotely. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks:

  • Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
  • Design and optimize machine learning systems and deep learning architectures;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI/ML solutions into existing products or processes;
  • Design the IT architecture for solutions in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts;
  • Conduct data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation;
  • Maintain AI deployed solutions on SaaS platforms (AWS, Azure);
  • Document architecture blueprints and discuss business requirements.


Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 15 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Very good knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs), Text embeddings, Tokenization and Vectorization, Machine and Deep Learning;
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of Python/Java/Containers (Docker/Kubernetes)/Cloud AI services (AWS, Azure);
  • Good knowledge of natural language processing systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies;
  • Good knowledge of quality assurance and quality control for machine translation (MT) and experience with MT quality procedures, testing methodologies and tools, such as automatic quality metrics (BLEU scores and similar) and human evaluation of MT quality;
  • One of the following certificates would be considered a very strong asset:
  • -AWS Certified Machine Learning / Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate
  • -AWS Certified Data Analytics / Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate
  • -AWS Certified Solutions Architect / Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert
    • Excellent command of the English language, good understanding of French would be considered an asset.

    Benefits

    If you are seeking a career in an exciting, dynamic and multicultural international environment with exciting opportunities that will boost your career, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18238/02/2025).

    We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

    You may also consider all our other open vacancies by visiting the career section of our web site (www.eurodyn.com) and follow us on Twitter (@EURODYN_Careers) and LinkedIn.

    EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading European Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Berlin, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Valetta, Vienna, Den Haag, Hong Kong, etc.) The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc). We design and develop software applications using integrated, state-of-the-art technology. Our current IT projects have a value exceeding 300 million EURO. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to European Union Institutions, international organizations, European Agencies and national government Administrations in 40 countries and 4 continents.

    As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, age, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.


    EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer (Freelancer)
Description:
Hashlist is a platform for tech positions & projects within the automotive industry.




We establish supplier relationships with automotive companies and provide a one-stop shop for candidates interested in working in the industry.




Are you ready to be a part of that journey?




As an Artificial Intelligence Engineer Freelancer, you will join our trusted network to work on cutting-edge R&D projects in the automotive sector, contributing to innovative solutions that enhance autonomous driving capabilities and the safety of tomorrow. You will bring deep expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence, ideally with prior experience in developing autonomous products, radar systems, or applications that heavily leverage AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of building secure, high-performing solutions designed to meet industry standards.




Your presence can be in the Netherlands, Germany, Belgium or France.

Occasional traveling is required but you can work 80% from home.




Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and optimize AI models and algorithms for automotive sector applications, including autonomous systems, radars, and AI-driven decision-making tools.
Develop secure, high-performance software solutions tailored to meet the stringent requirements of automotive industry projects.
Identify and address vulnerabilities in AI systems, ensuring robust cybersecurity measures are integrated throughout the development lifecycle.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI capabilities with overall system architectures, ensuring seamless integration and performance.
Conduct rigorous testing, validation, and documentation of AI solutions to ensure reliability, scalability, and compliance with industry standards.




Qualifications:

Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field
Strong skills in Pattern Recognition, Neural Networks, and Algorithms.
Experience in developing products that rely on AI/ML capabilities such as autonomous systems, radar technologies, or other AI-reliant applications.
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Familiarity with secure system design, cybersecurity principles, and compliance




Next steps:

Press "Apply"
We will review your application
If qualified, you will be accepted into the network and can be considered for this and similar positions & projects
Show more

Title: Data & AI Science Consultant
Description:
Are you willing to make a step in your career and deliver Analytics or AI products from early discovery stages up to industrialized solutions to re-imagine the future of the industry as part of large transformation projects?

If this is the case, this role will be of interest to you!

Team



Be at the forefront of the industry, you’ll create, own and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.


Become an integral part of our Data& AI team with the credibility, expertise and insight clients depend on.


Be working with famous brands and household names – no worrying about how to explain what you do to your family again!


Work alongside global teams to collaborate and deliver the best solutions for our clients.


Align with our industry partners to develop your career and the solutions we deliver for our clients.


Develop others by bringing your unique knowledge and skillsets to the wider practice.



Process



Drive and implement real world solutions into production that drive business value to our clients


Solve challenging business problems using advanced machine learning methods such as Deep Learning and quantitative analytics.


Understand business requirements and support the development of business cases.


Run discovery analytics to identify new and innovative opportunities.


Partner with developers and engineers to deploy machine learning algorithms to deliver business value.


Define approaches to embed and scale machine learning models.


Build reusable assets, solutions and develop best practices for current and future business problems.


Consult on complex analyses and advanced machine learning methods.


Communicate and provide guidance to senior client leadership and teams.



Data



Contribute data science expertise to new sales activities.


Shape DS Strategy and the delivery of DS solutions.


Operate across multiple industries and functions.


Develop others by bringing your unique knowledge and skillsets to the wider practice.



Your team

The Data and AI revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Join Accenture and help transform leading organisations and communities around the world. Accenture Data and AI Science is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate with the ecosystem, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Accenture’s Data and AI practice covers the range of Data and AI skills, from Strategy, Data Science, Data Architecture, AI Engineering and Visual Insights. When combined with Accenture’s broader Strategy and Consulting practice, we are able to bring together the unique ability to drive end to end business change through the application of Data and AI. You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways. If you’re looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you. As part of our global team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job.

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too. “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” – Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO

Your background



Relevant work experience in data science, machine learning, and business analytics


Practical experience in coding languages eg. Python, R, Scala, etc.; (Python preferred)


Proficiency in database technologies eg. SQL, ETL, No-SQL, DW, and Big Data technologies e.g. pySpark, Hive, etc.


Experienced working with structured and also unstructured data eg. Text, PDFs, jpgs, call recordings, video, etc.


Knowledge of machine learning modelling techniques and how to fine-tune those models eg. XGBoost, Deep Neural Networks, Transformers, Markov chains, etc.


Experience using specialized machine learning libraries e.g. Fastai, Keras, Tensorflow, pytorch, sci-kit learn, huggingface, etc.


Must demonstrate the capacity of reading, understanding and implementing new techniques in the field of machine learning as they emerge.


Experience of using Cloud technologies eg. AWS, GCP or Azure.


Specialised visualisation techniques eg. D3.js, ggplot etc.


Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills


Awareness of Large Language Models (LLMs) and a strong enthusiasm for continuous learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in the field



Bonus point If you…



Willingness and ability to learn quickly and apply creative thinking to finding great solutions and drive their implementation


Ability to successfully build relationships with clients and stakeholders


Mastery of problem solving and solutioning


Proven history and background in statistics/mathematics/macroeconomics



Our offer

Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:



13th month + holiday allowance


20 + 12 holidays


Laptop and smartphone


Hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package


Bonus program


Training & learning opportunities


Green mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,…


Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits tool


Discount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shops


Employee shares purchase plan


Eco-cheques


And many more!



Show more

We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too. “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” – Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO

    Your background


  • Relevant work experience in data science, machine learning, and business analytics

  • Practical experience in coding languages eg. Python, R, Scala, etc.; (Python preferred)

  • Proficiency in database technologies eg. SQL, ETL, No-SQL, DW, and Big Data technologies e.g. pySpark, Hive, etc.

  • Experienced working with structured and also unstructured data eg. Text, PDFs, jpgs, call recordings, video, etc.

  • Knowledge of machine learning modelling techniques and how to fine-tune those models eg. XGBoost, Deep Neural Networks, Transformers, Markov chains, etc.

  • Experience using specialized machine learning libraries e.g. Fastai, Keras, Tensorflow, pytorch, sci-kit learn, huggingface, etc.

  • Must demonstrate the capacity of reading, understanding and implementing new techniques in the field of machine learning as they emerge.

  • Experience of using Cloud technologies eg. AWS, GCP or Azure.

  • Specialised visualisation techniques eg. D3.js, ggplot etc.

  • Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills

  • Awareness of Large Language Models (LLMs) and a strong enthusiasm for continuous learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in the field


    • Bonus point If you…


  • Willingness and ability to learn quickly and apply creative thinking to finding great solutions and drive their implementation

  • Ability to successfully build relationships with clients and stakeholders

  • Mastery of problem solving and solutioning

  • Proven history and background in statistics/mathematics/macroeconomics


    • Our offer

    Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re really proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.

    Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:


  • 13th month + holiday allowance

  • 20 + 12 holidays

  • Laptop and smartphone

  • Hospitalization insurance and extensive group insurance package

  • Bonus program

  • Training & learning opportunities

  • Green mobility program: e-bikes, public transport, bike 2 work allowance,…

  • Flexrewards: decide on your rewards package with our flexible benefits tool

  • Discount program: get discounts at your favorite (online) shops

  • Employee shares purchase plan

  • Eco-cheques

  • And many more!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat betekent:


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je herkent jezelf in de volgende competenties:


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast kan je rekenen op:


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Jobreq: 50260

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over de selectieprocedure:

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only




What is Cream all about?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company specialized in IT development and Business improvement. We are active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




Cream’s special recipe:

- 1/3 of Personal development

- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence

- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)




Your tasks :

Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.




How do we imagine our future consultant?

You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
You have a Master’s degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business




Why should you taste the lime flavor?

· A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box

· You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues

· You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology

· You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company

· We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE, CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Battery Research Engineer
Description:
3E is looking for a new expert to reinforce the innovation team in the development of digital solutions with a focus on storage (BESS) applications for utility-scale implementation.




In this role, you work closely together with the storage scientist who is conducting the research in order to understand the needed components and features for the application to be succesful. Your job will be to translate these findings into a proof of concept through scientific programming, with which our software development team can get to work to create the commercial software package to integrate into our platform.




As a storage developer in the innovation department, you will support our team by:

contributing to the scientific development (in Python) of our physics-based and AI-powered storage analytics
actively following up the state-of-the-art to continuously improve our digital twin model for assets flexibility and storage applications
bringing the R&D results to real-life implementation through programming, analyse data, and developing models to optimize storage performance and operation and in this way, delivering proof of concept
managing and contributing to the execution and acquisition of R&D projects, funded at European, national, or regional levels;
providing support to solution owners to define the R&D strategy, in line with our internal roadmap







If you are an open-minded and proactive team player with good communication skills who enjoys challenges and growing an innovative product to the next level you're at the right place at 3E!




Our ideal candidate comes with:

A master's degree in Engineering, physics or similar
1-2 years of hands-on experience in advanced analytics [Physics-based modelling/ Machine learning/ Blackbox]
We are open to a rather junior profile with the right skills and mindset, who can work autonomously and efficiently in a flexible environment.
An innovative mindset with strong innovation skills, finding the right balance between state-of-art, reliability and cost-efficiency
Knowledge of Battery assets and Flexibility in power grids.
Proficiency in Python and data science stack




You get bonus points for:

Experience with innovation-oriented programming and data science
Software development skills such as Object Oriented programming and use of Git
Knowledge of battery market integration in ancillary services
Spanish, French or Dutch proficiency







Our offices are hidden in the centre of Brussels with a view on a pond, with ducks and a heron bringing a regular visit. In addition to a stimulating atmosphere in a highly motivated group of people, 3E offers a unique opportunity to further develop yourself in a company/team with an ambitious growth plan, delivering innovative services.




In return for your hard work we offer:

Salary in line with your level of experience
Benefits: group insurance, hospital insurance, meal vouchers (8 euros), eco vouchers, representation allowance, company mobile phone + subscription, 32 days of vacation and a flexible income plan.
Sustainable transport: easy access with public transport, 100% reimbursement of public transport fare, bicycle allowance.
Home working (2 days per week), flexible & gliding working hours
An international environment with colleagues of 25+ nationalities and projects in over 100 countries.
An non-judgemental, open-minded company where everybody can bring their ideas to the table
Show more

Title: Business Developer
Description:
TK Elevator is een van 's werelds toonaangevende liftfabrikanten. Wij creëren innovatieve oplossingen en geven mede vorm aan de toekomst van mobiliteit. Wij verkopen, moderniseren en onderhouden liften, roltrappen, platformliften en parkeersystemen. Daarbij is klantenservice essentieel.

Voor ons bedrijf in België zijn we op zoek naar een Business Developer. Hij/zij zal verantwoordelijk zijn voor het ontwikkelen en ondersteunen van onze nieuwe installatiesprojecten bij onze toekomstige en huidige klanten.

Jouw taken:

Goede relaties opbouwen met interne en externe klanten
Een sterke klantenrelatie opbouwen
Markt en klantenprospectie
Klantenportefeuille uitbreiden en uitdiepen
Marktevoluties en technologische evoluties detecteren en gezamelijk oplossingen ontwikkelen
Samen met de klanten naar oplossingen zoeken voor een optimale projectuitvoering
Een nauwe samenwerking met de interne diensten om de optimale en kostefficiënte oplossingen aan te reiken
In samenwerking met de NI directeur de markt- en klanten strategieën bepalen

Jouw profiel:

Je hebt een graduaat en minstens 5 jaar werkervaring in een technische verkoopfunctie
Je vaardigheden omvatten communicatie, onderhandelen, reactievermogen en het behandelen van een groot aantal dossiers tegelijkertijd
Je hebt een doorzettingsvermogen en een hoge stressbestendigheid
Ervaring in de liften is een troef, geen must!
Je werkt graag zowel in teamverband als zelfstandig
je bent klantgericht, hebt verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en hecht veel belang aan gezondheid en veiligheid op het werk
Je hebt een geldig rijbewijs
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Engels, Franse kennis is een plus

Ons aanbod:

Als onderdeel van je onboarding krijg je een breed scala aan opleidingen en word je begeleid door een mentor om je te helpen bij het inwerken in de functie.

Ons bedrijf is voortdurend in ontwikkeling, net als onze digitale transformatie, dus we zijn altijd op zoek naar doorlopende training.
Beloning in overeenstemming met je ervaring en vaardigheden
Een bedrijfswagen is ook beschikbaar voor privégebruik
Een bedrijfscultuur die individuele ontwikkeling en ontplooiing stimuleert

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Project Manager - Prompt Engineering / Data Scientist (Brussels Based)
Description:
About SailPeak

At Sailpeak, we are a Brussels-based consulting firm specializing in guiding Banking & Insurance firms through the complexities of digital transformation.




With expertise in Business Strategy, Data & AI, and Digital Transformation, Sailpeak helps clients navigate the ever-evolving landscape and reach new heights of success.




🤖 About the Role

We are looking for a Prompt Engineer / Data Scientist with 3 years of experience, working on Gen AI tools to improve internal processes




One of our leading banking clients is leveraging data science across many use cases to create value in crucial projects.




You will spearhead the transformation with tools like ChatGPT and Microsoft Office CoPilot to improve employee productivity and efficiency across processes. The use cases can come from Robotics, Compliance, Client Service Centers, Marketing, and Sales (the list keeps growing).




📊 You will:

Design and Create prompts using prompt engineering techniques
Understand business needs to identify cases where Gen AI can be leveraged to add value to our projects
Test and Evaluate the quality and accuracy of the output from your prompts
Train and Educate the rest of the business on the best practices around using GenAI & working on establishing a prompt academy (learning environment)
Document and Share your findings, results, and learnings with the rest of the business




📊 You bring to the table:

Experience working with Gen AI tools: ChatGPT, Mistral, Llama, and Microsoft Office CoPilot
Expertise in Advance Prompt Engineering from designing, creating, testing, and optimizing prompts
Independence and ability to plan your own work based on project requirements
Strategic thinking around aligning the current business needs and gaps in processes
Experience working with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Business, Product, etc.)
Stakeholder management (being able to communicate with various different stakeholders, managing roadblocks and frustrations, etc.)




🗣️ Language Skills

Fluency in English, French, and/or Dutch




🤹 Other Skills

Experience with Scrum or Agile methods is a great plus for us.
We are looking for proactive problem-solvers
You’ll be working independently & autonomously
Passion for growing, building, and continuous learning, especially around the developments within AI and Data Science
Working with cross-functional teams with different business needs, requirements, and challenges




🎁 What’s in it for you

💸 A competitive salary and benefits package.

🦾 Working on cutting-edge projects with leading banking clients, in a startup environment

💿 Exposure to a wide array of AI and data science technologies.

🫂 Mentorship from Directors and Partners with backgrounds from renowned companies like Google, PayPal, Semetis, and Sia Partners.




🧑‍🔬 The Process

Step 1: 30-minute call with our Head of Talent (Peter): focusing on your current situation, motivation, experience, and practicalities
Step 2: 30-minute call with one of our Founders (Stjepan or Nico): deep-dive into your experience
Step 3: Onsite Business Case with our team
Step 4: Offer!




Are you ready to embark on a rewarding career in management consulting with Sailpeak?




To apply for this role, kindly send your CV or reach out to careers@sailpeak.com




Set your course toward a transformative career at Sailpeak today!

Show more

Title: Job | Data Scientist AI Lab | Brussel
Description:
Omschrijving

Door machine learning (ML) en artificiële intelligentie (AI) te gebruiken genereer je datagestuurde producten en breng je de meest urgente zakelijke uitdagingen tot een goed einde.

De job in een notendop

Je werkt in het AI Lab binnen een jong, vernieuwend en dynamisch team om transversale AI-projecten end-to-end te realiseren.

Je gebruikt diverse soorten data – interne en externe, gestructureerde en ongestructureerde – om bestaande use cases te verbeteren en nieuwe use cases op te starten. Dat kan voor alle bank- en verzekeringsactiviteiten: marketing, compliance, fraude, procesautomatisering…

Wat je doet, is heel divers:


Je bouwt/verbetert voorspellende modellen met behulp van statistische technieken en machine learning.
Je gebruikt large language models of andere generatieve AI modellen om concrete oplossingen te bieden voor business-noden.
Je maakt, analyseert en interpreteert businesshypotheses en benut datasets.
Je beveelt de business ideeën aan wanneer er data/resultaten beschikbaar zijn aan de hand van visualisaties/voorspellende algoritmes.
Je helpt gebruikers om inzicht te verwerven in de principes van datawetenschap en je licht indien nodig de gedragingen van het model en mogelijke corrigerende acties toe.



Jij hoeft geen witte raaf te zijn

Al kan je er bij ons wel één worden. Bij ons mag je volop je vleugels uitslaan indien je voldoet aan de volgende voorwaarden:


Een master of doctoraat in de wetenschappen met uitstekende academische resultaten op technisch gebied (econometrie, computerwetenschappen, artificiële intelligentie, e.a.).
Deskundigheid op het vlak van machine learning technieken en bereidheid om die kennis up-to-date te houden; een diepgaande kennis van algoritmes zoals Random Forests, Neural Networks en Reinforcement Learning is hierbij een must.
Ervaring met het toepassen van Generative AI modellen zoals large language models.
Sterke programmeervaardigheden in Python en SQL en noties van MLOps & CI/CD.
Uitgebreide kennis van Nederlands of Frans, met passieve kennis van de andere taal, en Engels.
Ervaring in het verklaren van complexe analyses aan een niet-technisch publiek aan de hand van je verhalende competenties en je capaciteit om data te visualiseren; je beschikt over uitmuntende mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatievaardigheden op technisch en businessniveau.
Honger naar kennis, niet alleen om nieuwe algoritmes en technologieën te beheersen, maar ook op interpersoonlijk vlak; je bent je ervan bewust dat de waarde van jouw werk neerkomt op kwaliteit x acceptatie en je wilt sleutelen aan beide aspecten.
Uitzonderlijke probleemoplossende vaardigheden: je weet dat het juiste inzicht in een probleem minstens 90% van de oplossing uitmaakt, je geeft blijk van creativiteit en volharding bij het doorgronden van problemen en het zoeken van oplossingen.



Je scoort extra met:


Tweetaligheid (Nederlands/Frans).
Ervaring met het bouwen van data- en softwareproducten, van ontwerp tot productie.
Eerdere ervaring met Natural Language Processing.
Kennis van Spark en libraries/tools voor visualisatie (zoals Plotly/Dash of React).
Noties van cloud, bij voorkeur Azure.



Belfius koestert zijn talenten

Behalve de kans om elke dag te shinen, bieden wij jou een fulltime contract van onbepaalde duur met:


Een mooi loon aangevuld met een innovatief aanbod om een persoonlijk budget samen te stellen dat je kan besteden volgens je voorkeuren (bv. wagen, fiets, pc, smartphone, tablet, huisvesting onder bepaalde voorwaarden) en extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, personeelsvoordeel op eigen producten en diensten, en een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Mogelijkheden te over om je te ontwikkelen door een brede waaier aan opleidingen en carrièrekansen in de hele Belfius-groep
Een goede werk-privé balans dankzij flexibele uren, de combinatie kantoor- en thuiswerk en een aantrekkelijk aantal vakantiedagen
Een moderne werkplek in het hart van Brussel met een coole fitness, een lekker gezond restaurant en gezellige ontmoetingsruimtes, dit alles op wandelafstand van de winkelstraat, het treinstation Brussel-Noord en de metrohalte Rogier

Show more

Title: Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, AI/ML & Analytics
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on an end-to-end data analytics and mlops solution composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on workflow, ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers; we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

Location: This initiative spans many teams that are home-based and in multiple time zones. We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hourse! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

What your day will look like


Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing
Work with both Kubernetes and machine-oriented open source applications
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions


What we are looking for in you


Professional or academic software delivery using Python
Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have



The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.


Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions for the cloud.
Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Working knowledge of cloud computing
Passionate about software quality and testing
Experience working on an open source project


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
  • Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Junior Site Reliability Engineer
Description:
About the Role - The Junior SysOps Engineer plays an operational role in incident analysis, diagnostic improvement and process documentation. He/She ensures rigorous monitoring of alerts and performance indicators and participates in the development of SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) and ITIL best practices







Responsibilities




Monitoring and management of alerts
Ensure real-time monitoring of alerts reported by supervision tools (infrastructure, middleware, applications) and by suppliers.
Qualify first-level incidents based on existing runbooks and checklists.
Alert and escalate complex incidents to the Senior SysOps and LEV2/LEV3 teams (LOT1, LOT2, LOT3).
Participate in on-call duty to ensure continuity of 24/7 support.
Initial diagnosis and documentation of incidents
Collect and analyze logs, metrics and performance indicators to facilitate incident diagnosis.
Complete incident reports and ensure the updating of tickets in the ITSM tool (JIRA).
Contribute to improving the knowledge base by enriching the documentation with feedback.
Technical assistance and support for LEV1
Help LEV1 teams understand and interpret technical alerts.
Explain the mechanisms of recurring incidents and suggest improvements to speed up their resolution.
Provide operational support in ticket management and tracking until resolution.
Participation in postmortems and continuous improvement
Attend “blame-free” postmortems and contribute to the analysis of critical incidents.
Identify and suggest improvements to limit the recurrence of incidents.
Monitor performance indicators (SLI, SLO, SLA, MTTD, MTTR) and help improve them.
Updating and improving runbooks and playbooks
Write and update runbooks and operational procedures for LEV1.
Ensure the clarity and accessibility of guides to guarantee a good understanding of the processes.
Work in collaboration with the Senior SysOps to enrich internal repositories.
Monitoring and skills development
Acquire progressive expertise on managed technical environments (Linux, Kubernetes, Kafka, databases, monitoring).
Experiment with supervision, automation and observability tools to improve skills.










Qualification and Required Skills




Relevant bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in computer science or related field.
A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience to perform the advertised tasks.
Good understanding and experience in SRE / Operations principles and frameworks, DevOps and DevSecOps principles.
Fluent in French or Dutch




Technical Skills / Nice to have

Systems: Good understanding of Linux environments.
Virtualization & Containers: Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes (a plus).
Middleware & Messaging: Notions of Kafka, JBoss, SpringBoot, HAProxy.
Observability and Monitoring: Familiarity with tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, ELK.
Databases: Knowledge of PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL.
Automation & Scripting: Basic knowledge of Bash, Python, Ansible.
SRE Methodology: Understanding of SLI, SLO principles, postmortems, advanced monitoring.
ITIL v4: Awareness of Incident, Problem, Change Management processes.




Must have Skills:

Organizational and Interpersonal Skills
Ability to learn quickly and improve skills.
Analytical and synthesis skills to identify and document incidents.
Sense of collaboration and ability to work in a team.
Good written and oral communication skills to document and popularize technical problems.
Rigor and autonomy in monitoring alerts and managing tickets.

Show more
