Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
The hiring company´s mission is to enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof. With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, they empower their clients to unleash and scale the power of their data. They're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations.




Who you are

4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role.
Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers).
Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology).
Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models.
Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow).
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML).
Familiarity with REST API and microservices.
Fluent in German AND English




Your tasks

s a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally.
Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes.
Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills.
Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere.
Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way.




Perks & Benefits

A competitive compensation package.
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve.
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind.
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us.
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth.
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset.




Location

This opportunity is to be based in Lausanne with a flexibility of 2 days home office / week.




Salary

The budget for this opportunity is based on profile.

Title: Applied AI Research Scientist
Description:
Company Overview

We are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $50M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. We have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Our technology is based on 15 years of research by our founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device giving us commercial access to 43 countries worldwide.

High blood pressure is the world's most common disease and causes 18M deaths/year. At Aktiia, we believe that our novel technology is the key to building the fundamental datasets for the next chapter of understanding and discovery in the field of blood pressure. Before Aktiia, it was not possible to do this at scale. To strengthen our team, we are looking for a:

APPLIED AI RESEARCH SCIENTIST

Responsibilities


Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems



Your profile


M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Strong publication record in Machine Learning or AI
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Motivated, proactive, and curious, with a structured, solution-oriented mindset; a team player eager to learn
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit


Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches? In this case you are ready to rock with Aktiia team. We look forward to receiving your application by email (18DA2655CC@jobs.workablemail.com).

Only fully documented applications (CV, diplomas) will be considered for the recruitment process. If you should not hear back from us within two weeks, your application has unfortunately not been successful for this role.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We're not just another tech company; we're revolutionizing how millions of people experience their digital experience.

At Nexthink, we’re the pioneers of Digital Employee Experience (DEX) technology. Using a powerful mix of real-time analytics, clever automation, and cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning, we're helping some of the world's biggest companies create digital workplaces that delight their employees at work. Think of us as the architects of the future workplace!

We’re a team of passionate tech enthusiasts, problem solvers, and innovators. At Nexthink, collaboration is key—we encourage curiosity, creativity, and bold thinking. If you love solving real-world challenges and want to be part of an exciting growth journey, you might just be the Nexthinker we’re looking for!

Are you passionate about AI and eager to turn that enthusiasm into real-world impact? Do you want to learn from experienced AI engineers while working on cutting-edge solutions? If so, this is your opportunity to join Nexthink as a Junior AI Engineer!

As a Junior AI Engineer, you’ll be part of a dynamic and collaborative AI team, gaining hands-on experience in building AI solutions deployed on the cloud with an impact on millions of employees worldwide.

This role offers an incredible opportunity to:


Build your expertise in modern AI technologies (LLM, AI agents, …) and frameworks (Python, Langchain, …)
Learn how to develop scalable and resilient software in a cloud production-environment
Contribute to meaningful projects that impact our customers
Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team where questions are encouraged
Grow your career with mentorship from experienced AI and software engineers


If you're ready to start your journey in AI engineering and are excited about learning while doing so, we want to hear from you!

Even if you don't check every box, we encourage you to apply. We value potential and enthusiasm just as much as experience!

Qualifications

We're not expecting you to know everything! What we're looking for is:


MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, ML or related field
A solid foundation in AI, ML and software engineering
Genuine curiosity about building cloud product at scale and enthusiasm for solving real-world problems
Strong willingness to learn and adapt
Clear communication skills (English) with technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Logmind is a dynamic and innovative startup based in Lausanne, Switzerland, specializing in cloud-based AIOps solution. Our platform automatically detects issues within an organization's application and infrastructure logs and alert data, enabling IT teams in large enterprises to proactively identify and resolve technical problems in complex IT environments.




We are looking for an entrepreneurial and collaborative team member with hands-on experience in machine learning, predictive analytics, and software engineering.




Your qualifications & competencies:

MSc or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related fields.
Expertise in modern programming languages and analytics tools such as Python, Scala, Kafka, Spark, Elasticsearch, etc.
Expertise in data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures (e.g., GPT, BERT, or similar models).
Motivated and passionate about large-scale machine learning problems, with the ability to think big and execute effectively.
Good communication skills - ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
Relevant IT industry experience would be a plus.




Your responsibilities:

Design, prototype, and develop advanced algorithms for processing time-series text and metric data.
Implement, test, and optimize proposed algorithms for large-scale environments, ensuring efficiency and scalability with real-time data streams.
Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed methods into the core platform.
Analyze large datasets to uncover insights, improve detection accuracy and refine model performance.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, deep learning, and observability to drive continuous innovation.




Advantages of working with us:

Unique career development and growth opportunities
Work with a friendly, motivated and talented team
Opportunity to have a real impact and to make a difference for both customers and the internal team
Work in a fast-growing and innovative start-up environment from the office at EPFL Innovation Park.




We offer full-time positions based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Thus, you have to be eligible to work and live in Switzerland.

Show more

Your qualifications & competencies:

  • MSc or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, mathematics or related fields.
  • Expertise in modern programming languages and analytics tools such as Python, Scala, Kafka, Spark, Elasticsearch, etc.
  • Expertise in data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, anomaly detection, sequential pattern discovery, and text mining.
  • Experience with large language models (LLMs) and transformer-based architectures (e.g., GPT, BERT, or similar models).
  • Motivated and passionate about large-scale machine learning problems, with the ability to think big and execute effectively.
  • Good communication skills - ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audience.
  • Relevant IT industry experience would be a plus.


Your responsibilities:

  • Design, prototype, and develop advanced algorithms for processing time-series text and metric data.
  • Implement, test, and optimize proposed algorithms for large-scale environments, ensuring efficiency and scalability with real-time data streams.
  • Closely collaborate with the software engineering team to integrate proposed methods into the core platform.
  • Analyze large datasets to uncover insights, improve detection accuracy and refine model performance.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends in AI, deep learning, and observability to drive continuous innovation.


Advantages of working with us:

  • Unique career development and growth opportunities
  • Work with a friendly, motivated and talented team
  • Opportunity to have a real impact and to make a difference for both customers and the internal team
  • Work in a fast-growing and innovative start-up environment from the office at EPFL Innovation Park.


We offer full-time positions based in Lausanne, Switzerland. Thus, you have to be eligible to work and live in Switzerland.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Remote, CET Timezone)
Description:
We’re a Swiss startup using AI and advanced optimization algorithms to transform logistics. Our solutions help Fortune 500 companies to cut logistics costs by over 20% while reducing CO2 emissions through smarter packing and freight utilization. Join a mission-driven team where innovation meets impact, transforming global supply chains for a sustainable future.




🚀 What You’ll Do

As Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll advance our core optimization algorithms by:

Designing, implementing and training reinforcement learning models to solve complex high-dimensional optimization problems.
Building scalable training pipelines and deploying solutions on Azure/GCP.
Ship code that matters: Build models used daily by large enterprise companies.




⚡ What We Offer

Compensation: Competitive salary, plus potential for equity for exceptional candidates.
Impact: Solve real-world challenges for Fortune 500 companies.
Autonomy: Lead projects with ownership in a fast-paced, flat-hierarchy startup.
Flexibility: Remote-first and results-driven.




🔍 We Need You To Have

Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field.
Industry Experience: 2+ years in ML engineering roles.
RL Experience: Strong background in reinforcement learning and algorithm development.
Python & PyTorch: Strong proficiency in Python (NumPy, Pandas, PyTorch).
Deployed models to the cloud (Azure/GCP preferred).
Independent problem-solver and communicates complex ideas clearly.
Fluent in English and a proactive communicator.




🌟 Bonus Points For

Familiarity with logistics or operations research.
Experience with optimization libraries and integer programming is a plus.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zurich / Remote

Contract: 6-month Freelance (with possibility of extension)




Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative Biotech company focused on transforming Drug Discovery through AI. if you're passionate about AI for Science, we're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing team.




Job Description:

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a high-impact, mission-driven team working on the forefront of AI research. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.




Required Skills:

3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

Title: AI/ML Ops Engineer
Description:
RED are currently looking for a AI/ML Ops Engineer to work on a project with a key client of ours based in Zurich, Switzerland. This particular role is a long term contract opportunity starting at 6 months + likely extensions and requires someone who can work hybrid in Zurich.




We are looking for skills in the following:

7+ Years of relevant experience in Design and implementation of ML Ops solutions on cloud (preferably Azure)
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Expertise in programming languages such as Python or Java
Experience in deployment technologies such as Kubernetes or Docker
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, large language models and statistical modelling.
Experience in Azure cloud platform and Azure ML services




If this is something that is of interest then please apply directly and someone will be in touch to discuss the requirement further.

Title: Data Scientist, Product, Ads Metrics
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience with statistical data analysis, data mining, and querying (e.g., SQL).
1 year of experience managing analytical projects.
Experience with statistics and business analysis.


Preferred qualifications:


Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Operations Research, Bioinformatics, Economics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or Engineering), or a related field.
3 years of experience in scripting, statistical analysis (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, SAS), developing and managing metrics, and evaluating programs/products.
Experience with database languages (SQL) and statistical software (Python).
Experience in data analysis to solve business problems in complex, fast-moving, and ambiguous business environments, with strong data intuition and business acumen.
Excellent scientific writing, communication, and presentation skills.


About The Job

Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Data Scientists provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. You relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.

Google Ads is helping power the open internet with the best technology that connects and creates value for people, publishers, advertisers, and Google. We’re made up of multiple teams, building Google’s Advertising products including search, display, shopping, travel and video advertising, as well as analytics. Our teams create trusted experiences between people and businesses with useful ads. We help grow businesses of all sizes from small businesses, to large brands, to YouTube creators, with effective advertiser tools that deliver measurable results. We also enable Google to engage with customers at scale.

Responsibilities


Own the process of gathering, extracting, and compiling data across sources via relevant tools (e.g., SQL, R, Python). Format, re-structure, and validate data to ensure quality.
Run business-critical ad-hoc product analyses with fast turnaround and present results to executive stakeholders to deliver insights and support product decisions in Search Ads.
Collaborate with Product Managers, Engineers, and other Data Scientists to identify and clarify business or product questions, and translate them into tractable analyses and metrics.
Develop and maintain product health metrics and dashboards to track key performance indicators, identify trends, and provide insights. Ensure data quality and consistency to empower other teams in delivering insights.
Identify and size opportunities for product growth and improvement, such as increasing adoption, reducing churn, or improving performance, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement solutions.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Research Engineer in Machine Learning
Description:
Responsibilities

Develop and implement deep learning systems in a financial industry context
Cooperate in R&D teams to execute projects related to the finanical industry. Strong collaboration with other software engineers, researchers and industry partners.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate NLP and deep learning technologies into practical applications.  
Prototype AI systems. Apply state-of-the-art techniques in deep learning, transformers, large language models, and parameter-efficient fine-tuning.




Requirements

Master Degree in Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, or equivalent background.
Exceptional coding skills and deep technical expertise in AI development. Extensive experience with the implementation of deep learning systems.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with modern ML tools.  Experience with deep learning libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow/ONNX) and NumPy.
Ability to work independently and on schedule.
The candidate should be among the top 5 % of Master graduates of their university.




Desired skills

Experience with reinforcement learning.
Experience of work/research in a financial context is a plus but not required.
Research experience/ a PhD are a plus but not required.
Knowledge of the following is a plus:
Relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Containerization tools (e.g., Docker).
Expertise in CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab, CircleCI).
Microservices architecture and REST APIs.




We offer

Fixed-term employment contract.
No obligation to teach or participate in the university maintenance.
Participation in cutting edge research to bring forward top notch research partners in the financial industry .
Sufficient time to pursue research work in collaboration and publication.
An international working environment.
Attractive salary, in line with Swiss standards and the candidate's experience.




Join us

Provide a CV, your university transcripts and relevant additional information

Title: Senior Data Scientist 100%
Description:
Swiss Medical Network ist eine der beiden führenden privaten Klinik- und Spitalgruppen in der Schweiz. Mit einer ausgezeichneten medizinischen Infrastruktur bietet sie Patientinnen und Patienten sowohl ambulant als auch stationär erstklassige Behandlungen in allen Fachgebieten.

Swiss Medial Network umfasst über 21 Kliniken und Spitäler sowie über 60 ambulante Zentren in den vier Hauptsprachregionen des Landes. 





Stellenbeschreibung



Gestalten Sie die Zukunft der Datenanalyse bei Swiss Medical Network! Als Senior Data Scientist sind Sie ein Eckpfeiler unseres Data & Analytics Team und entwickeln innovative, nachhaltige und datenorientierte Lösungen, um die Gesundheitsversorgung von morgen zu verbessern.





Qualifikationen



Ihre Verantwortlichkeiten:



Strategische Führung: Weiterentwicklung und Umsetzung der Data & Analytics Strategie in Übereinstimmung mit den Unternehmenszielen.



Teamentwicklung: Orientierung, Coaching und Mentoring des Data & Analytics Teams, Förderung der fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung der Teammitglieder.



Projektmanagement: Priorisierung, Planung, Steuerung und Überwachung von Data Analytics Projekten, inkl. Budgetverwaltung, Risikomanagement und Sicherstellung der termingerechten Umsetzung.



Bedarfsermittlung: In Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Business Analysten fordern Sie die von den Nutzern geäusserten Bedürfnisse heraus, haben eine globale Sicht und schlagen Optimierungslösungen vor.



Anwenderkommunikation: Proaktive Kommunikation mit Anwendern und Stakeholdern, Vermittlung komplexer technischer Konzepte in verständlicher Form, Erfassung und Analyse von Anforderungen.



Weiterentwicklung der Data&Analytics Maturität: Zyklische Analyse des aktuellen Reifegrades der Analytics-Fähigkeiten anhand des HIMSS AMAM Reifegradmodells, Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Massnahmen zur Erreichung der nächsten Reifestufe.



Modellentwicklung und -implementierung: Entwicklung, Implementierung und Validierung von Machine Learning Modellen / LLMs zur Lösung von geschäftlichen Herausforderungen im Gesundheitswesen, inkl. Modelloptimierung, -überwachung und -dokumentation.



Datenanalyse und -interpretation: Analyse grosser und komplexer Datensätze aus verschiedenen Quellen, Gewinnung von verwertbaren Erkenntnissen und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen in Zusammenarbeit mit den Data-Engineers und Data-Analysts.



Technologiebeobachtung: Beobachtung und Bewertung neuer Technologien und Trends im Bereich Data Analytics und Science, Identifizierung von Innovationspotenzialen für Swiss Medical Network.



Data & Analytics Self-Service: Erarbeitung und Umsetzung eines Self-Service Konzepts, um den Endnutzern mehr Autonomie und Kompetenz zu verschaffen.



Anforderungsprofil:



Masterabschluss oder Promotion in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem verwandten Bereich.



Mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Science, vorzugsweise im Gesundheitswesen.



Fundierte Kenntnisse in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, statistischen Modellierungsverfahren und Data Mining.



Erfahrung mit Big Data Technologien und der Analyse grosser Datensätze.



Expertise in der Entwicklung, Implementierung und Validierung von Machine Learning Modellen.



Ausgeprägte Führungs- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.



Sehr gute Deutsch- und Französischkenntnisse, Englischkenntnisse sind von Vorteil.



Kenntnisse des HIMSS AMAM Maturity Models und Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Analytics-Strategien.



Hohes analytisches Denkvermögen, Kreativität und Problemlösungsfähigkeit.



Selbstständige und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise.



Kenntnisse der Google Cloud Platform Welt ist ein Plus.









Zusätzliche Informationen



Unser Angebot



Eine herausfordernde und abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem dynamischen und zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen.



Die Möglichkeit, die Zukunft der Datenanalyse im Gesundheitswesen aktiv mitzugestalten.



Ein attraktives Gehalt und umfangreiche Sozialleistungen.



Ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld und flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle.



Individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten und Weiterbildungsangebote.



Eintrittsdatum
per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung



Arbeitsort



Zürich, Basel, Solothurn, Sion, Freiburg, Genf oder Lausanne (Projekte in der ganzen Schweiz)







Senden Sie uns Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inklusive Diplome und Zeugnisse) bitte via unsere Internetseite.



Diese Stelle besetzen wir ohne Stellenvermittler. Es werden nur Bewerbungen berücksichtigt, die dem oben genannten Profil entsprechen.

Senden Sie uns Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (inklusive Diplome und Zeugnisse) bitte via unsere Internetseite.

Diese Stelle besetzen wir ohne Stellenvermittler. Es werden nur Bewerbungen berücksichtigt, die dem oben genannten Profil entsprechen.

Title: University Graduate – Junior Data Scientist (Flex-Track) 100% (f/m/d)
Description:
At Julius Baer, we celebrate and value the individual qualities you bring, enabling you to be impactful, to be entrepreneurial, to be empowered, and to create value beyond wealth. Let’s shape the future of wealth management together.

Kick-start your career with Julius Baer’s Graduate Programme in October 2025

Are you about to complete your master’s degree or have recently graduated? Are you ready to embark on a journey that combines passion for wealth management, ambition, and excellence?

Our Flex-Track Graduate Programme is an 18-month journey designed to unleash your full potential, offering three rotations in different teams, including an international assignment. As a Flex-Track Graduate, you are in the driving seat to define your rotations 2 and 3 within all departments of the bank. This unique opportunity will immerse you in Julius Baer’s global network, provide hands-on experience, and lay the foundation for a thriving career in wealth management.

Your team

Join the CRO division and become part of the Analytics & Transformation Team in Zurich. The Analytics & Transformation team provides technical solutions and objective critical thinking to help the Bank manage risks, and address remediation and investigations. We support an array of stakeholders within CRO globally, who turn to us for assistance with quantifying non-financial risk, developing predictive models, implementing new technologies, and deliver financial or economic analyses. During the Graduate Programme, you will have the opportunity to work in three highly skilled, purpose-built teams with experience in analytics, risk, compliance, banking and finance, enabling you to enrich your technical and business knowledge

What you get


An individualised career path with opportunities to become an expert in a chosen field
Dynamic insights by rotating through different teams and international experience
A steep learning curve, driven by demanding and fast-paced rotation tracks
Opportunities to be impactful and make a difference
Strong community and regular individual touchpoints with experienced professionals


Start date: 1 October 2025

Curious to learn more about our Graduate Programme?

Visit our careers website: https://www.juliusbaer.com/en/careers/graduates/

YOUR CHALLENGE

What to work on?


Work with complex data sets, uncovering trends or patterns that can be used to extract valuable insights to be used by Risk and Compliance Officers, senior leaders, and supervisory authorities
Design, build and maintain pragmatic and statistically rigorous solutions to concrete problems raised by our internal clients by leveraging statistical and machine learning methodologies
Work closely with business analysts and CRO teams to answer important risk questions using scientific techniques and research methods
Think creatively, proactively, and innovatively to identify new opportunities within Julius Baer’s long-term roadmap for analytics


What to learn?


Developing and testing robust prescriptive and predictive models that allows the division to deliver on the roadmap for analytics
Collaborate with colleagues and senior leaders globally to implement analytics solutions that create effectiveness and efficiency in various Banking processes
Synthesize data and methodologies into actionable risk monitoring strategies
Communicate effectively, understand, and make visible the value the data and developed solutions provided to the division


YOUR PROFILE


Master's degree from a university or university of applied sciences with above-average grades in a quantitative field (Financial Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or equivalent) Graduation date no more than 12 months ago
Initial practical experience with dataset analysis and model creation using R or Python
Experience navigating SQL databases
Enthusiastic about leveraging data and statistical knowledge to solve complex problems
Committed researcher, constantly curious, questioning ideas and showing a keen interest in learning about our methods
Team-oriented individual, enjoys collaborating with a diversity of experts, listening to different ideas, and voicing their own to deliver the best possible outcome
A global mindset, excellent interpersonal skills, and a strong appetite for learning
Fluency in English, with additional languages being a plus
Eligibility to work in the country where you apply for the position


We are looking forward to receiving your full job application through our online application tool. Further interesting job opportunities can be found on our Career site.

Is this not quite what you are looking for? Set up a job alert by creating a candidate account here.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
GenAI Engineer – 750 - 850 CHF Per Day – 6 Months – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)




Overview:

A market leading consultancy operating globally is searching for an experienced GenAI Engineer to join one of their Investment Banking clients in Zurich for a 6-month contract (with likely extensions thereafter).




Technical Requirements:

7+ years of IT experience with a minimum of 2 years in GenAI based solution design and implementation.
Proficiency in developing and fine-tuning Gen AI models, including prompt engineering, model finetuning, and deployment.
Ability to create and maintain prompt flow pipelines, streamline AI model performance, and enhance interaction with LLM-based systems.
Strong programming experience in Python.
Proven experience working on the MS Azure cloud platform and its native tech stack in designing and building data & AI solutions.
Experience in building cloud data pipelines using Azure native programming techniques such as PySpark or Scala and Databricks for sourcing, enriching, and maintaining structured and unstructured data sets for analysis and reporting.
Experience working in an agile environment, leveraging DevOps and test-driven development techniques.




Rate & Duration:

750 - 850 CHF
6 Months (Likely Extensions)
Zurich, Switzerland (Hybrid)




GenAI Engineer – 750 - 850 CHF Per Day – 6 Months – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)

Title: AI Engineer - Reinforcement Learning
Description:
We are looking for a software engineer to strengthen our reinforcement learning team in Zurich. The goal of this position is the development and deployment of state of the art learning-based controllers in simulation and on real hardware.

Requirements

Hands on experience with robotic hardware, reinforcement learning and dev-ops is required.

Particularly:


PhD or master's degree in robot control or reinforcement learning with relevant project experience (e.g. master thesis)
Good knowledge of Python, PyTorch, C++, ONNX
Experience with dev-op workflows and corresponding tools, including docker and singularity
Good knowledge of ROS, ROS2 and simulation environments
Experience with server infrastructure and cloud deployment


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment, and who is able and willing to take ownership of projects and decisions.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

The Position

As a Data Scientist you will join the data science cluster in the Roche Informatics Data and Analytics Chapter (DnA). You will be part of one or several multi-disciplinary agile teams where you’ll actively craft the future of healthcare by using data science methods and principles to generate deeper insights from a phenomenal variety of data sources. To achieve this, you will proactively identify needs, design and implement analytical solutions, provide advice and consulting support to our key stakeholders and show impact by executing proof-of-value initiatives, or contributing to existing products.

The Opportunity:


Research, design, and implement state-of-the-art NLP models, focusing on large-scale transformer architectures
Fine-tune and optimize pre-trained LLMs for domain-specific applications
Develop, test, and deploy NLP solutions for tasks such as text classification, named entity recognition, sentiment analysis, summarization, and conversational AI
Work with large-scale datasets, including data preprocessing, augmentation, and feature engineering
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate NLP models into scalable applications and platforms
Conduct research and stay up to date with advancements in deep learning, NLP, and LLMs to improve the company's AI capabilities
Optimize model efficiency, reducing computational costs while maintaining performance
Ensure ethical AI practices, addressing bias, fairness, and interpretability in NLP applications
Mentor junior data scientists and collaborate with cross-functional teams


Who you are:


PhD in Computer Science with experience in Generative AI
Hands-on experience with Python programming and common NLP libraries (e.g., transformers, gensim, spaCy, etc.)
Strong experience with transformer-based architectures (GPT, BERT, LLaMA, etc.)
Proficiency in Python and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Hands-on experience with NLP libraries like Hugging Face Transformers, SpaCy, NLTK, and OpenAI’s API
Experience working with cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and deploying AI models at scale
Knowledge of MLOps, including model versioning, deployment pipelines, and monitoring
Proven understanding of software engineering best practices, including Git, CI/CD, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Excellent problem-solving skills, research ability, and communication skills
International, results oriented mindset with can do attitude
Proficiency in written and spoken English


Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche Kaiseraugst is a cornerstone of Roche's global production and logistics network. It employs some 1900 people out of the 10,700 employees at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site and is Roche's largest and most innovative packaging facility worldwide. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion, and strive to identify and create opportunities that enable all people to bring their unique selves to Roche.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Show more

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description:
Meta is embarking on the most transformative change to its business and technology in company history, and our Machine Learning Engineers are at the forefront of this evolution. We are seeking a high skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in developing cutting-edge algorithms for future Meta's wearables devices.

Software Engineer, Machine Learning Responsibilities:


Build, iterate and optimize models and experiment to build state-of-the-art performance within wearable devices constraints
Develop and implement data augmentation techniques to improve model performance and robustness
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and clinical experts, to integrate ML models into existing systems and products
Evaluate and optimize model performance using various metrics and techniques, such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, and ROC-AUC
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, signal processing and related fields. Apply this knowledge to improve model performance and innovation
Document and communicate technical findings and results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of best practices for ML engineering within the company


Minimum Qualifications:


Strong experience in machine learning, signal processing, and software development
Experience in building and deploying models that can accurately make inference from high-frequency sensor signals
Programming skills in languages such as Python
Familiarity with signal processing techniques and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, and Pandas
Experience with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
Understanding of machine learning concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, classification, clustering, and dimensionality reduction
Proven experience of working prioritizing and working efficiently, to drive the most impactful work forwards
Proven experience with Machine Learning model pipeline, topology and architecture, hyper-parameter optimization


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with wearable device data, or other low-level sensor data sources
Experience with transfer learning, domain adaptation, and few-shot learning
Familiarity with Explainable AI techniques and libraries such as LIME, SHAP, or TreeExplainer
Certification in machine learning, data science, or a related field


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.
Show more

Title: Competitions Data Scientist
Description:
Job information

Division/Unit: Football Division/Club Competitions

Contract type: Permanent

Start date: 01.04.25 or as soon as possible

Application deadline: 27.02.2025

Main goal

The UEFA Football Division is seeking a passionate Data Scientist with expertise in spatial analytics to join our team. You will use advanced algorithms and data analysis to enhance decision-making and drive innovation in on-pitch and off-pitch football research. We’re looking for a self-starter with a deep enthusiasm for football and a commitment to advancing our data insights. If you’re excited about cutting-edge football analytics, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Leading and contributing to innovative research in football analytics, exploring new methods and technologies to advance our understanding of on-pitch actions, the development of competitions and off-pitch trends
Overseeing the collection, cleaning and organisation of complex data sets to ensure scalable data pipelines, accuracy and usability for analysis
Working closely with team members and stakeholders to translate data findings into clear, actionable recommendations and to support data-driven strategies
Designing and implementing advanced algorithms and analytical models to extract actionable insights from on-pitch and off-pitch football data
Leading external agencies with the delivery of advanced analytics projects and integrating the methods for replication internally
Contributing to the evolution of the Unit in charge of the strategic development of the competitions. Performing quantitative analysis and developing mathematical tools and statistical models
Supporting the head of the Unit to build presentations to make the use of the data comprehensive for the end users.

Requirements

Experience


At least 4 years of experience in data science using R and/or Python, preferably with sports or performance data
Experience with visualisation tools like Tableau or Dataiku is a plus; prior work with a sports organisation is an additional asset


Education:


Academic background in statistics, data science, sports analytics or a related field


Languages:


English: Proficient


Other requirements:


Knowledge of European football
Proficiency in Python for data manipulation and preparation, using Pandas, NumPy and Scikit-learn, with experience in spatial analytics and skeletal data using GeoPandas and Shapely
Expertise in data manipulation, preparation, and sports-specific modelling techniques
Familiarity with APIs, AWS (S3) and relevant data repositories
Knowledge of SQL or Snowflake is a plus

HTML:
Job information

Division/Unit: Football Division/Club Competitions

Contract type: Permanent

Start date: 01.04.25 or as soon as possible

Application deadline: 27.02.2025

Main goal

The UEFA Football Division is seeking a passionate Data Scientist with expertise in spatial analytics to join our team. You will use advanced algorithms and data analysis to enhance decision-making and drive innovation in on-pitch and off-pitch football research. We’re looking for a self-starter with a deep enthusiasm for football and a commitment to advancing our data insights. If you’re excited about cutting-edge football analytics, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities

  • Leading and contributing to innovative research in football analytics, exploring new methods and technologies to advance our understanding of on-pitch actions, the development of competitions and off-pitch trends
  • Overseeing the collection, cleaning and organisation of complex data sets to ensure scalable data pipelines, accuracy and usability for analysis
  • Working closely with team members and stakeholders to translate data findings into clear, actionable recommendations and to support data-driven strategies
  • Designing and implementing advanced algorithms and analytical models to extract actionable insights from on-pitch and off-pitch football data
  • Leading external agencies with the delivery of advanced analytics projects and integrating the methods for replication internally
  • Contributing to the evolution of the Unit in charge of the strategic development of the competitions. Performing quantitative analysis and developing mathematical tools and statistical models
  • Supporting the head of the Unit to build presentations to make the use of the data comprehensive for the end users.

Requirements

Experience

  • At least 4 years of experience in data science using R and/or Python, preferably with sports or performance data
  • Experience with visualisation tools like Tableau or Dataiku is a plus; prior work with a sports organisation is an additional asset

Education:

  • Academic background in statistics, data science, sports analytics or a related field

Languages:

  • English: Proficient

Other requirements:

  • Knowledge of European football
  • Proficiency in Python for data manipulation and preparation, using Pandas, NumPy and Scikit-learn, with experience in spatial analytics and skeletal data using GeoPandas and Shapely
  • Expertise in data manipulation, preparation, and sports-specific modelling techniques
  • Familiarity with APIs, AWS (S3) and relevant data repositories
  • Knowledge of SQL or Snowflake is a plus

Title: AI Research Scientist in Applied ML
Description:
Job Description

Join Intel and build a better tomorrow. We create world-changing technology that improves the life of every person on the planet every day in ways that you probably don't even see. We have big ambitions, and a passion to work with others and address world challenges no one can tackle alone. We would love to have you be a part of this. Intel CCG SEG SAI Research Lab is creating the next generation of AI systems, pushing the boundaries of research and technology to produce a positive impact on society and create better AI PC user experiences. You have now the opportunity to join our world-class team of international researchers and engineers, working together to unleash the power of AI at scale.

Our lab is researching technological trends and advancements of AI PC and client computing technology. We are currently working on multiple research problems combining ideas from multiple domains, Machine Learning, Computer Graphics, and Computer Vision, Video Generation, immersive AI PC experiences.

We are looking for researchers who are passionate about one or several of the topics below:


Great interest in language model architectures
Next generation image/video and 3D content creation
AI agents and agentic AI and transfer of technology from autonomous & robotics systems
Evaluation and optimization of model architectures components especially for diffusion and regression based on software libraries and hardware approaches; optimization of multi-device execution
You will be responsible for conceiving, researching, prototyping, and publishing new techniques in one of the domains listed above. You are expected to have a strong knowledge of mathematics, algorithmic techniques, and machine learning.
You will also need to have a comprehensive understanding of the state of the art and to be a regular contributor to top scientific venues (e.g., CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, SIGGRAPH, RSS, ICRA).
The successful candidate will also possess strong communication skills and a team-oriented mindset and have strong connections with academia.


What do we offer?


A collaborative, supportive environment, where your equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best.
Competitive pay
Diverse and inclusive environment (read more about it here)
Being a part of a socially and ecologically responsible company (read more about it here).
Dedicated training for you during your first weeks at the company to make your transition into work easier and a personal buddy to help you build your network, answer any questions and integrate you into your position.
Opportunities for professional development - wide library of online trainings and learning platforms, support and guidance from your team and manager, and different assignment programs.
The possibility to build a lifelong career at Intel. We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today.


Qualifications

You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through schoolwork and/or classes and/or project work and/or internships and/or military training and/or work experience.

Minimum Qualifications


The candidate must have a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or similar technical areas or in final year of PhD program
3+ publication in first-tier highly selective international conferences such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGGRAPH, or ICRA, ACL, EMNLP
3+ years of experience in at least one of the following areas: Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, agent based & autonomous systems, AI-based optimization techniques


Preferred Qualifications


Software engineering experience demonstrated through publicly available software systems, strong background in optimization-based research experience (e.g. in autonomous and agentic system) is beneficial for planned machine learning and neural rendering-related research. Experience with resource-constrained and real-time systems is a plus.
4+ publications in first-tier highly selective international conferences or journals such as CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGGRAPH, ICRA, robotics & automation conf, ACL, EMNLP


Inside this Business Group

The Client Computing Group (CCG) is responsible for driving business strategy and product development for Intel's PC products and platforms, spanning form factors such as notebooks, desktops, 2 in 1s, all in ones. Working with our partners across the industry, we intend to deliver purposeful computing experiences that unlock people's potential - allowing each person use our products to focus, create and connect in ways that matter most to them. As the largest business unit at Intel, CCG is investing more heavily in the PC, ramping its capabilities even more aggressively, and designing the PC experience even more deliberately, including delivering a predictable cadence of leadership products. As a result, we are able to fuel innovation across Intel, providing an important source of IP and scale, as well as help the company deliver on its purpose of enriching the lives of every person on earth.

Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Working Model

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. * Job posting details (such as work model, location or time type) are subject to change.

Title: AI Engineer - Robotics Internship
Description:
We are looking for interns to support us in the development and deployment of learning-based models on our robot.

Requirements

Hands-on experience in working with machine learning models, including training and fine-tuning. Robotics experience is a plus but not required.

Particularly:


Currently pursuing a PhD degree or close to master's degree graduation in robotics, core ML, computer graphics or computer vision
Excellent knowledge of Python, PyTorch
Experience in C++ is a plus
Experience in state of the art perception models
Experience in robot control
Experience in reinforcement learning & diffusion models is a plus


We are looking for a person who enjoys working in a team in a very dynamic and fast-moving environment.

Benefits

We at Flexion Robotics (flexion.ai) are a young company in Zurich working on the next generation of humanoid robot software to enable robots to perform useful tasks autonomously.

We work dynamically and move fast. The team is still fairly small and every new employee at this stage will have significant ownership of their current project.

We offer a competitive remuneration in the form of a competitive base salary and additional components/benefits depending on the specific role and the experience of the applicant.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a skilled and passionate Data Scientist to join a dynamic team with our client based in the Zurich area.




In this exciting role, you'll be part of an international team, playing a key part in shaping and developing an innovative product that makes a real impact.




If you have a degree in a related field, 5+ years of experience in data science, a strong grasp of statistics, and exceptional Python skills, we want to hear from you! Fluency in German is a big plus, and experience with SQL, Spark, and MLOps will set you apart.




Ready for your next career move? Apply now directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com!

Title: Data Scientist - Data Quality and Completeness CHF90-110k
Description:
About Orderfox




Orderfox is redefining AI-driven industrial intelligence with cutting-edge solutions for data-driven decision-making and smart procurement automation. Our mission is to empower businesses with next-generation AI tools that enhance operational efficiency, uncover market insights, and drive competitive advantage.




Our Products





Gieni AI – An advanced AI-powered market intelligence engine that analyzes data from over 380 million websites worldwide, providing businesses with real-time insights, deep industry analytics, and predictive intelligence to stay ahead of the competition.


Partfox – Partfox is an AI-powered, commission-free platform that connects buyers with manufacturers based on precise CNC machine capabilities. Buyers can upload part specifications (STEP, PDF) and receive instant matches with suitable manufacturers. The platform ensures transparent, efficient procurement by enabling direct communication without intermediaries. Manufacturers can showcase their machine capacities and gain visibility to attract the right projects.



Tasks


- We can only accept applications from within the EU - no VISA support -




We are looking for a Data Scientist specializing in data quality, completeness, and AI-driven automation, with a strong focus on LLM-powered retrieval and process orchestration.




This role is not about traditional machine learning model training—our focus is on agentic AI workflows, efficient data processing, and scalable automation using LLMs via inference APIs (OpenAI, Bedrock, AI Foundry, etc.). You will work with distributed computing, data lakes, vector search, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) techniques to optimize knowledge access for AI-driven applications.




Core Focus Areas (Top Priorities)





Agentic Prompt Engineering (Langflow, AgentOps, etc.) – Designing dynamic LLM prompts, chains, and automation workflows.


Distributed Computing & Process Orchestration (Airflow, Kestra, AWS Batch, Databricks, etc.) – Managing large-scale workflows with automation and fault tolerance.


Data Lake Access & Processing (Presto, AWS Athena, etc.) – Efficiently handling big data retrieval, querying, and optimization.


Vector & Semantic Search (pgvector, ChromaDB, MeiliSearch, etc.) – Building high-performance search and retrieval systems for LLM-powered AI.


Advanced / Agentic RAG (Graph RAG, Recursive RAG, Modular RAG, text chunking techniques, etc.) – Implementing next-generation knowledge retrieval architectures.





Additional Responsibilities





Ensure data quality & completeness across large-scale structured and unstructured datasets.


Automate data validation, cleansing, and transformation for LLM & AI pipelines.


Develop scalable vector databases & search solutions to improve retrieval efficiency.


Work with graph databases for knowledge representation and structured reasoning.


Optimize RAG-based AI pipelines for fast, contextually relevant information retrieval.


Collaborate with engineers & AI researchers to refine data access and orchestration.


Version control & automation using Git and CI/CD best practices.Stay updated on latest AI trends, LLM advancements, and data infrastructure.



Requirements


Required Skills & Experience





Programming: Python, SQL, R.


Agentic Prompt Engineering: Langflow, AgentOps, LlamaIndex, AutoGPT frameworks.


Process Orchestration & Distributed Computing: Airflow, Kestra, AWS Batch, Databricks.


Data Lake Access & Processing: Presto, AWS Athena for large-scale data retrieval.


Vector & Semantic Search: pgvector, ChromaDB, MeiliSearch.


Advanced RAG Techniques: Graph RAG, Recursive RAG, Modular RAG, text chunking.


Big Data & Storage: Spark, Hadoop for processing large datasets.


Cloud Platforms: AWS, GCP, Azure for AI-powered workloads.


Data Quality & Governance: Ensuring high data integrity & compliance.


Version Control & Collaboration: Git, CI/CD pipelines for AI workflow management.


Ethics & AI Governance: Understanding of data privacy and ethical AI applications.





Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)





Graph Databases (Neo4j, ArangoDB) for AI knowledge graphs.


MLOps & LLMOps (Docker, Kubernetes) for scalable AI deployments.


Enterprise AI Data Pipelines – Experience building production-ready AI retrieval systems.LLM Fine-tuning & Multimodal AI (if needed in the future).



Benefits



Be at the forefront of AI innovation – Work with LLMs, agentic AI, vector search, and advanced RAG in a high-impact environment.


Shape the future of AI-driven industry intelligence – Develop solutions that redefine market research, procurement, and supply chain automation.


Global impact – Our products power businesses across industries, enabling smarter decision-making and efficiency at scale.


Tech-first culture – Work with the latest in LLM orchestration, distributed computing, and AI-powered retrieval, collaborating with top engineers and data scientists.


Career growth and learning – Join a team that values continuous learning, innovation, and professional development.Competitive compensation and flexibility – Benefit from a strong salary, remote work options, and an agile, fast-moving team environment.





We Look Forward to Your Application




If you are passionate about AI-driven data quality, retrieval, and process automation, we would love to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of industrial intelligence and apply today!

  • MLOps & LLMOps (Docker, Kubernetes) for scalable AI deployments.

  • Enterprise AI Data Pipelines – Experience building production-ready AI retrieval systems.LLM Fine-tuning & Multimodal AI (if needed in the future).


Benefits

  • Be at the forefront of AI innovation – Work with LLMs, agentic AI, vector search, and advanced RAG in a high-impact environment.

  • Shape the future of AI-driven industry intelligence – Develop solutions that redefine market research, procurement, and supply chain automation.

  • Global impact – Our products power businesses across industries, enabling smarter decision-making and efficiency at scale.

Title: Data Science Internship / Working Student
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as; data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments


Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss


What We Offer


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultural environment
Working with senior tech leads
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


at least one programming/scripting language
database technologies and a query language
data engineering and science basics


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage


Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.
Show more

  • at least one programming/scripting language

  • data engineering and science basics

Soft Skills

  • Willingness to learn
  • Enjoyment of problem solving
  • English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage

Additional Information

We look forward to your direct online application.

What You'll Do


Build and deploy scalable AI-powered web applications using modern frameworks like Node.js, React, and TypeScript.
Develop machine learning workflows with a focus on large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and optimize AI solutions.

Why Join Us?

Opportunities for growth and learning.
Competitive salary and flexible work options.

Title: Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern
Description:
About Corintis




Corintis offers innovative microfluidic cooling technologies for data centers. Our solutions improve compute sustainability and tackle the excessive electricity consumption associated with data center cooling, which consumes more electricity than New York and London combined. By integrating cooling directly inside the chip, we pave the way for the next generation of AI workloads, supporting applications like generative AI systems, climate modeling, and drug discovery to enable the future of sustainable computing.




Working at Corintis




Corintis offers a friendly and team-oriented workplace bringing together a diverse group of nationalities to solve the biggest computing challenges of tomorrow. Based on the EPFL campus near Lausanne, we are closely connected to the local ecosystem and are located a few minutes walk from Lake Geneva.




Job Description




As a Scientific Machine Learning Engineering Intern at Corintis, you'll play a crucial role by leveraging your skills in Scientific Machine Learning (ML) and Computational Science & Engineering to accelerate the optimization of our groundbreaking microfluidic cooling technology. This role offers an exciting opportunity to directly contribute to the evolution of sustainable computing solutions, including, but not limited to, future AI workloads. In essence, you'll be employing ML to accelerate the design of a cooling system for the very same machine - or its future iteration - enhancing its performance and efficiency.




Responsibilities




Apply ML methods such as Neural Operators for Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) to predict the performance of microfluidics for microchip cooling.
Enhance current ML models and algorithms for improved prediction accuracy and computational efficiency. We would be interested in investigating Group Equivariant Neural Networks for rotation invariance or implementing various data enhancement techniques such as Neural Field Representations, and others.
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineers and scientists to integrate ML solutions into our Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) framework and our design and optimization process.
Continuously monitor and incorporate the latest research and developments in the fields of ML, CFD and topology optimization into our methodologies.
Analyze complex datasets, interpret patterns and trends, and contribute to the evolution of our topology optimization strategies.
Contribute to the formulation of objective functions based on specific design criteria and constraints.
Develop creative and innovative solutions that address the complex challenges of integrating ML, fluid dynamics and microfluidics.




Requirements




Background in computational engineering, computational science, mathematics, physics, or mechanical engineering.
Extensive knowledge of Machine/Deep Learning techniques and architectures.
Proficient in Python and an ML open source library, preferably PyTorch.
Experience in working with open source tools and Git (GitHub).
Interest in CFD and experience with simulation methods.
Ability to think outside of the box and freely discuss creative solutions.
Demonstrated ability to write clear, high-quality technical documentation.
Autonomous and proactive working style with excellent organization and work ethics.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work in a team with diverse professions and cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English.
Please attach a letter of motivation with your CV




Strongly desirable




Experience with training large datasets using GPUs, preferably multi-thread training on High Performance Computing (HPC) Systems.
Familiarity with using Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) for modeling physical phenomena.
Familiarity with the Finite Element Method (FEM) for the numerical solution of PDEs.
Experience in reduced-order modeling for the numerical solution of PDEs and/or scientific ML.
Experience in applying the aforementioned techniques for fluid dynamics problems (Navier-Stokes and/or Darcy flow).




What we offer




A dynamic, flexible, innovative, and multicultural work environment

Start date: Immediately

Contract: Paid Internship (6-months preferred, flexible) 2,500 CHF gross per month

Activity rate: 100%

Location: On-site, Corintis SA (Building C), EPFL Innovation Park, Switzerland

Show more

Title: Senior NLP Data Scientist (W/M)
Description:
About The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC)

The Swiss Data Science Center (SDSC) is a strategic focus area of the ETH domain, with EPFL and ETH Zurich as founding partners, developing into a National Research Infrastructure in 2025. Its mission is to support academic labs, hospitals, industry and public sector stakeholders, including cantonal and federal administrations, through their entire data science journey, from the collection and management of data to machine learning, AI, and industrialization. With a large multidisciplinary team of professionals across three locations (Lausanne, Zurich, Villigen), the SDSC provides expertise and services to various domains, such as health and biomedical sciences, energy and sustainability, climate and environment, and large-scale scientific infrastructures. More: www.datascience.ch

The Research team is responsible for research collaborations in the academic and public sector. See https://datascience.ch/academic-projects/ for an idea of some of our academic research collaborations.

Mission

As a Senior Data Scientist with expertise in NLP working in the Research team of the Swiss Data Science Center, you will help researchers and other collaborators in academia or the public sector in Switzerland to leverage state-of-the-art NLP models. In particular, you will assist collaborators from various fields in carrying out projects based on textual or related data (potentially multi-modal), and notably in health and biomedical sciences, climate and environment, energy and sustainability, and social sciences.

This typically involves exchanging actively with collaborators and domain experts to understand the precise desiderata of the project, determining which approaches, formulations, and language models are most effective to achieve the desired goals, implement the corresponding algorithms, perform evaluation together with collaborators, and release open-source code and write research papers when appropriate.

Main Duties And Responsibilities Include


Working on projects in NLP with collaborators from the academic and public sector.


You will also contribute to


Advising MSc Students.
Evaluating project proposals


Profile

The ideal candidate holds a PhD in NLP with experience in large language models and/or other foundation models. Of particular relevance are experience in training or fine-tuning (language) models of different sizes, familiarity with the characteristics of main language models and their applicability domains, experience with large-scale data projects. For large language models, beyond prompt engineering techniques, familiarity with fine-tuning and transfer methodologies would be of particular interest.

We expect the candidate to be typically proficient in Python, PyTorch, and familiar with Huggingface transformers, NLTK, etc.

We offer


A stimulating, cross-disciplinary environment
Opportunities for turning research into impactful solutions
Excellent ties to research groups worldwide


Informations

Contract Start Date : 01/04/2025

Activity Rate : 100.00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year renewable

Reference: 1453

Contact

Please contact Mathieu Salzmann (mathieu.salzmann@epfl.ch) or Guillaume Obozinski (guillaume.obozinski@sdsc.ethz.ch) for questions about the position (no applications).

Remark

Only candidates who applied through the EPFL website will be considered. Files sent by agencies without a mandate will not be considered.
